Add a classic touch to your exterior with this elegantly carved frieze.
Would You Like Frieze with That?
A gorgeous complement to the stateliest of homes, this frieze is truly timeless.
Add architectural interest to your walls without looking fussy.
Clean lines placed at varying distances intrigue the eye without overtiring it.
Bold, modern lines and unusual angles add reserved grandeur.

Child prodigy… or just the lucky owner of a Creative Art Thou Activity Table? Unlock your children’s genius and keep them positively busy with this pre-assembled table and chair set. Materials and talent not included.
A large bridge made of metal.
This is the Centurion Helmet Replica awning, as originally sketched by our 2nd grade class winning entry from Sophia Robertson. We knew you could do it Sophia. Go Wildcats.

Add a dash of style and shade with this built-to-last tile awning. Designed to blend beautifully with any Mediterranean-inspired home, this elegant addition protects you from the real or imagined sun.
Made in the Shade Tile Awning
Worried about UV exposure? This practical, wooden awning effectively shades your outdoor space, so you can bask in the shade in total safety.
Make life a parade of color with this two-tone striped awning set. Designed to block glare without dimming your outlook, the Dandy Striper is a cheerful addition to any home.
Curved Mission-style balcony with wrought iron rail. Romeo and Juliet-ready.
Mission-style balcony constructed from handsome wooden slats.
Mission-style balcony with wrought iron rails extends your indoor space outdoors.

Now everyone can shake their money maker! This white solid-surface bar offers just enough room for you to shake up drinks… while your guests strut their stuff on its high, shiny surface. Black-soled shoes not recommended.

Long on ambition but short on mixology skills? This extra-long bar allows for plenty of practice with both tapped drinks and juice cocktails. You might even get a workout sprinting from one end to the other!

Just one glance at this magnificent bar and you might get a little light-headed! Take another, longer look and you will want to sit down for a second. By the time you’ve fully taken in the fine craftsmanship and unparalleled beauty of the Indulgence, you’re practically dazed with admiration.

It's not a rec room; it's your own private club. "Swank" is the only proper word for this home bar replete with hardwood detailing, footrail, and sleek black bartop. Generous storage completes the package.
There's no better place to indulge your whim to create a bleeding-edge mixed drink for guests than behind the VAULT.
What better place to serve fancy flaming drinks than your very own Flaming Tiki Bar? Someone call the fire department…This party’s going to be HOT!

Princess Cordelia’s pirate boyfriends all had a weakness for root beer, until the princess introduced them to something better. Soon enough, they all had a weakness for lemonade instead-four kinds of it-which was much better for their scurvy. They often kept upright by bracing their legs (or pegs) on the handy brass foot rail below.

Designed to meet the demands of the most discerning foodie, this austere bar is made from professional-grade, heat-conducting stainless steel, with a broad prepping surface for whatever inspires you. Serve drinks, sushi, smoothies, locally-raised grass-fed beef… Just be careful with hot items.
Unlock by reaching level 10 of the Culinary career while in the Mixologist branch.
Unlocked at level 10 of the Culinary career while in the Mixologist branch.

Sure, this bar is only average looking, but the drinks you’ll mix here are way beyond average. In fact, the Sloop was crafted by pro surfer and master mixologist Don B. Dumm, for minimum strain and maximum inspiration.
Hush your little baby to sleep in this sweeter-than-anything bassinet. Extra-high sides keep baby secure while providing extra sound proofing, so Mommy or Daddy can sleep like a baby, too!
Hush your little baby to sleep in this sweeter-than-anything bassinet. Extra-high sides keep baby secure while providing extra sound proofing, so Mommy or Daddy can sleep like a baby, too!
Whether it be the rusty pipes, the dislodged tiles, or the conspicuous smell wafting from the last stall, this isn't a place anyone wants to be.
Whether it be the rusty pipes, the dislodged tiles, or the conspicuous smell wafting from the last stall, this isn't a place anyone wants to be.

Every culture has its version of the purification ceremony, where evil is washed away leaving only the pure and righteous. Claim your own ritual with Reclamation Homeware’s ultimate body, mind, and spirit cleansing station, The Epicure.
Tub floor inscribed with a map of the Quoswell crash site. Great collector's item!
Smell like a rose after a dip in this classic enameled clawfoot tub.
Supersize your soaking space with this simple tub for the tallest among us. Climb in, lay back, and bask in bubbles from your nose to your toes.
Splash your way to pure bliss in this delightfully smooth mahogany tub. Extra high back and head rest is angled just right for a soothing rest, and won’t overflow if you nod off and slip in.
Set sail for the best bath time ever in this jolly banded maritime tub! Extra deep body offers plenty of room for a butcher or baker, or just a solo scrub clean.
Transport yourself back to the days when baths were taken in wooden barrels, and discover why baths were hardly ever taken.

The porcelain for this bathtub was heated by a fire-breathing kraken that regularly attacked Princess Cordelia's submarine! When it attacked, the fire was channeled through a series of ducts before reaching the Eppsilon’s onboard kiln. How many other furniture companies can make this claim? Three or four, tops?
Don’t let the clean, Spartan lines of this tub fool you. Hidden inside its shiny walls are the tiniest microjets ever created, secretly massaging your tired muscles in true minimalist spirit.
This luxury jetted tub guarantees not only cleanliness but your own indoor jacuzzi experience.
Triteia Luxury Corner Bath with Jets
An extra-deep bathtub fitted with spa-quality water jets to soothe tired muscles and rejuvenate the spirit.
Also available in queen plus, king minus, cal-king, and king.

Every living creature from the mighty elephant to the tiniest blade of grass needs sanctuary, and we’re no exception. Our beds should be places of safety and comfort that allow our brain to participate unhindered in the magic of dreams. Like all of our furniture, this bed is made from reclaimed garbage. The Utopiate.
Your significant other will totally dig this audrinite-reinforced hyporeactive bed. Unparelleled buoyancy, minimal noise, and zero springboarding!

Once you climb into our Soothing Sleeper, you may never want to climb out! Its welcoming embrace is a prelude to the sweetest of dreams. The only way it could possibly be cozier… is to share it with someone else. Wink!
Ever slept in a barn? No? Well, get ready for the Barnish. Constructed of reclaimed barn doors with a gently hay-scented mattress, you'll be neighing your way to dreamland in no time.
This refined Mission-style bed is as solid as they come, so you can sleep in sturdy comfort, no matter how much your partner’s tossing and turning.

Princess Cordelia had a thing for pirates. Throughout her life she dated three of them. Their swashbuckling style carried over into one of her furniture lines, "Subaquatic Farrrrniture." This bed is fit for a sea captain and looks like it belongs on a galleon!

Constructed of weathered, kiln-dried pine, this classic bed is scarred with breathtaking cracks that enhance its beauty. Trace each scar with a finger, admire its knotty sides. No other bed has quite as much character as the Rustic Dream.
Unlock by reaching level 10 of the Painter career while in the Patron of the Arts branch
Unlocked at level 10 of the Painter career while in the Patron of the Arts branch.
Snuggle up in pure simplicity with this contemporary-style bed. In modern design, less is more, so enough said.

It is only when we close our eyes to temporal reality that we can truly unleash the imagination. To craft the perfect bed, we first took a nap. Its design came to us in a dream. Then, we built it—in our sleep. Made from the infinite potential of the subconscious mind. And garbage. The Eminence, by Reclamation Homeware.
Your significant other will totally dig this audrinite-reinforced hyporeactive bed. Unparelleled buoyancy, minimal noise, and zero springboarding! Cozy edition.
If there’s a cozier bed on the market than our Soothing Sleeper, we have never seen it. Climb into one and lose yourself to soft colors and softer curves. It’s like sleeping in a hug.
This narrow bed is made for dreaming… of a larger bed.

This chunky bed frame offers your child great back support, happy dreams, and the comfort of knowing that nothing, really...nothing! Is hiding under the bed. At Kindermade, comfort and safety are always the first things on our minds, at least where our customers are concerned.

Hand-crafted to solid perfection, this Mission-style bed is not only great for sleeping, its broad headboard and footboard are great for keeping books, lamps, lava lamps, dirty clothes and even a few knick-knacks… although they do detract slightly from the design.

Whenever Princess Cordelia grew tired of pirate breath, she retreated to the luxurious solitude of a bed such as this. The original bed was bolted down, but we’ve made it easier for landlubbers to transport-though it’s also a trifle easier to steal.
The clean, simple lines of this contemporary-style bed are soothingly functional. In modern design, less is more, so we’ll leave it at that.

Kindermade has finally extended their brand to the younger generation with a product made specifically for your toddler. This short (and stout!) bed is designed to provide a good night's rest and has enough space for parents to sit and read their little one to sleep.
Short and Stout Bed by Kindermade
Whether your toddler dreams of cars or chariots, this is a bed just for them.
Wood has been used to craft beds for centuries. If it was good enough for your great great grandparent’s ancestors, then it is good enough for your toddler.
For young explorers and imaginative dreamers. For little thinkers, keepers of toys and joy. This bed is perfect for all.
A compact with four blushes to choose from.
Correspond with Sunset Valley Pen Pal
Prepare for Small Talk Pop Quiz
By: Alfred Coholic \n\nLearn the basics of mixology to impress all your friends with this easy to follow guide.
By: Mona Huggins \n\nA quirky novel about a teenager who is separated from her high school sweetheart, only to cross paths and rekindle their romance overseas ten years later.
By: Dr. Phyllis \n\nA collection of articles explaining the successes and failures of ice-breakers. The author comments on how to react when considering a romantic relationship.
Pickup Lines for the Flirtatiously Inept

By: Max S.D. Zieners\n\nFeel like you have no control over your life? Like your successes and failures are due to inexorable outside forces? They just might be, but there's no need to fret! Learn to go with the flow, even as improbable situations cause your life to crash down around you in a puff of irony!
Taking Control: The Futility of Trying
By: Derek Nygma \n\nAn autobiographical narrative describing how one overcomes A.D.H.D. without the use of modern day medicine. A focused mind is a heightened mind.

By: Marlowe Nottacat \n\n"Hanging in There," "They Can Do It," "Be the Best Around," and other popular inspirational posters are examined to find their true meaning in this riveting book about motivation.
By: Robert Boss \n\nA collection of short stories and inspirational anecdotes that will leave you feeling calm, collected, and crafty!
Embracing the Moment and Inspiring Others

By: Daniel Chaperone \n\nBeginning with "knock-knock" and "yo mama" jokes, Daniel grew from entertaining a playground to having his own special. This story unlocks the secret of getting more than just a chuckle.

By: Rick Wood \n\nRick Wood was always a master of innuendos, but one day he takes a turn for the worse. Left with nothing but his wit, observation, and experience to draw on, he must escape a dinner party filled with stone-faced accountants.
By: Susie Saltwater\n\nThe perfect blend of passion and paragraphs.

By: Gladys McLain\n\nWorld-renowned sleep-runner, Gladys McLain, describes how she conquered her insomnia and transformed her sleep disorder into exercise. Each chapter will leave you feeling positively charged and ready to conquer the world!
By: Robin Taylor \n\nGrant Rodiek falls in love with a Corgi named Peaches, and neglects to farm points.
Point Farmer No More: The Downfall of Grant Rodiek
As we all know, today’s executive doesn’t have time to read - that’s what subordinates are for! But it’s important that your office decor gives you the authority of one who does.
Unlock by reaching level 8 of the Business career while in the Management branch.
Unlocked at level 8 of the Business career while in the Management branch.
All books need their own house. Whether about superheroes or princesses, books need a little rest when they aren't being read to toddlers. It's tough being a book.
As bold and bright as your little bookworm, this cheerful bookcase is great for holding… well, books. And maybe some toys, too.

A good bookcase, like a good book, should be a journey. Trace the unexpected lines of The Enigma by Reclamation Homeware, and you might be surprised where the journey takes you! And yes, it’s made entirely from old, discarded books (mostly teen supernatural/romance fiction).
Last year, scientists unveiled their solution for climate change: the zero-emission hoverbus! This to-scale model won't save the world, but it'll hold your stuff!
Built with the future in mind, this high-tech shelf stores books both analog and digital!
This imperfectly balanced, zen-inspired bookcase doesn’t have time for meditation. It’s young, and bright, and ready to be filled, like a vessel, with all life has in store.

The design of the Countryside Caress bookcase is so pleasing, you’ll wish you were a book just so you could slide inside and nestle into place among the tales of adventure and romance. Your books will be so happy here, they’ll get tingles up their spines!
Show off your impressive book collection on these two, slightly intimidating bookcases-an essential staple for anyone with half a brain, or more.
This bookshelf was custom-crafted for the Willow Creek Archive.
A practical place for knickknacks. Because even the modern minimalist has stuff that needs to be stored, and showed off, just a little.
This well-built shelving unit from PostRustic brings a bit of industrial flair to your book collection.
Add fun and color to your kids' rooms with this handmade bookcase from Kindermade. It offers convenient storage for your little ones' growing library.

If there’s only room for one piece of antique furniture in your home, it has to be a bookcase. There’s just something inherently old-fashioned about them! That’s why our team of precision robots is programmed to put extra care into each and every one of the hundreds of bookcases they assemble every day.

When Princess Cordelia fled to her submersible, she left most of her books behind. But she couldn’t bear to look uneducated, and so she had this bookcase constructed. Despite its delicate crablike legs, it’s actually built sturdily to withstand the occasional turbulence at sea.

Inspiration comes in many shapes and sizes, and so we created the Muse. With four standard bookshelves atop one taller compartment, the Muse also features two mysterious drawers and two shuttered cabinets, in order to conceal one’s lesser muses.
Unlock by reaching level 9 of the Writer career while in the Author branch.
Unlocked at level 9 of the Writer career while in the Author branch.
With four extra-deep shelves and room for more disheveled tomes on top, this solid-oak bookshelf is not for the intellectual lightweight.
Unlock by reaching level 10 of the Writer career while in the Journalist branch.
Unlocked at level 10 of the Writer career while in the Journalist branch.

As shapes go, the rectangle is rather under-celebrated, but in contemporary décor, it’s truly king. Versatile storage, uncluttered cabinetry, and tidy perfection: all achieved through rectangles and rectangles alone.

Inspired shelving, adding a chic look that can scale to any space to fit books, comic books, pots of plants, and knick knacks in style!\n\nMust be attached to a wall, unless a floating shelf is ok, but we don't think it can stand independently.
Why take up more room than you need to? This truly minimalist shelf set includes only the most necessary pieces. You can imagine the rest, if you want to.
"Funny and yet so true." -The SimTimes Book Club

Long before the shortly armed bipedal tyrants met their fate at the whims of a fiery rock or icy cold, these reptilian beasts strutted their stuff just beyond the primordial soup. With informative pictures and rhyming scientific names, Rex Treks is a journey to days a million past for children eager to take their first step in the fossil record.

There are times in a farmer’s life when they know that their one pig is not just some pig but the fun pig. Charlotte’s Pig is the charming, triumphant morality tale of a pig who teaches their owner that sometimes, you just need to look around and smell the bacon.

In the quiet town of Hannawee, a lonely family finds their hearts swollen with sadness when the rainy seasons begin. But, atop the log on the flooded river, a mysterious Dog on a Log arrives, and none of their lives will ever be the same.

Monkey Brown went up the bars and oops he fell and broke his thars. What should Monkey Brown have learned as a result of this handle-barred hiccup, and were the parents to blame? You won’t be able to stop this true crime (or is it a true accident?!) page turner of a toddler thriller.
Monkey Brown on the Monkey Bars

Little Antonio braves the forest to find the long lost Princess Plumbob, but with cherry red emotions he fumes that she isn’t in this castle, but is in another. Where is Princess Plumbob’s castle? Can it be found? Don’t flip forward as you’ll ruin the surprise!
Is it spring? Not now, but soon. Is it fall? Perhaps, by noon? Is it summer? The heat, seems likely. When is winter? Who knows, but it’s coming.

Before the younglings are ready for curves, straight lines, or fewer than four sides, we have Squares…and you! Squares and You is the Award-Winning landmark educational title that knocked Geometry in the Womb off its well-accolated perch and told Rhombus Rompus to take a hike!

In a world where we’re all unique snowflakes, it’s good to remind toddlers that sometimes they have more in common with others than their differences. Before beautiful hair grows, and muscles form, soft, plushy toddlers are all bald little similarities. Embrace it, at least for now.
Like You for the Time Being
Look to the lower atmosphere! What do you see? Is it a choo choo careening off the rails? Or a wanton bear looking for artisanal honey? No, it’s MaxisMan and he’s here to save the day!

Imagine a world in which the sandbox isn’t just filled with cold, lifeless toys, but vibrantly alive with ones that speak and emote! It’s all here in Toy Tales, a heartwarming story about how a young girl’s toys tell her how to reach for her dreams.

Put on your space suit little stumpy moon ranger and hop into the space boat because the whole family is going to Mars! In this charming picture book of our solar system, join along with Mary, Pete, and Squeazy Tom as they explore the Milky Way, and beyond, beginning with Mars in this first installment.

By: J.N. Brimley \n\nThe pen may be mightier than the sword, but no one expects the ol' book-to-the-face. Learn about the ol' book-to-the-face and so much more by reading this book! Go ahead, read it! That's right, lean in nice and close....
How to Seriously Injure Someone with this Book

By: Helmuth Von Gluck \n\nThings seem fine in the small town of Hergstrom, until the head of the chamber of commerce sends a vaguely worded email to a "frenemy." Now, the town is aflutter and M may soon stand for Murder....
By: Gobias Koffi \n\nA notable hater, Gobias Koffi reviews over a thousand varieties of what he considers the world’s grossest food, sausage.
By: Dominick VanDeesel \n\nYou might think it would be hard to fill 600 pages with stories about two friends fighting crime in race cars, but you’d be so, so wrong.

By: L.E.E. Tompkien \n\nThe playground has grown dangerous now that the school bully is back. Everyone is vying for the One Swing: a Swing that swings higher and faster than all others. Can Eduardo and his friends destroy the One Swing before Byron the Bully gets his grubby hands on it?
By: Emory "Big Boy" Carson \n\nIn a trio of satirical essays, Carson goes for the jugular, lampooning politicians, celebrity, and his own mother.
Somewhere, a Frog Just Learned to Jump Rope
By: Alfred Coholic \n\nReady to step up your mixology game? Then this book is for you!
Mixology Vol. 2: A Twist of Lime
By: Ginger Rosewater \n\nExpand your repertoire and impress your clientele with hundreds of unexpected elixirs from master mixologist Ginger Rosewater.
By: Alfred the Elder \n\nThis book describes advanced and dangerous Mixology techniques that have been past down in secret for generations. For experienced mixologists only.

By: Mike Trende \n\nAn old warrior and a girl from parallel worlds are out to save the world Unfantastica from an inexplicable power known as The Something. The tale becomes gradually less realistic and frustratingly almost comes to an end on every page.
By: Sergio Rockman \n\nA challenging piece that requires clean pedaling in order to make this song sound even halfway decent. Otherwise, it will sound like a pile of mush.

By: Greg Q.Q. Vartin \n\nAn epic fantasy series of feuding kingdoms, fascinating characters, and the complex power struggles to control those kingdoms. Characters groan as one by one they perish, and with the plethora of viewpoints, interwoven storylines, and plot twists, you too will groan as you try to keep it all straight.
By: Peter No Hau \n\nWhat's one string when you can play on two strings... or three? This piece explores double stops and the want for violinists to play like violists unintentionally do.
Etude in Double Stops and Other Fancy Things
By: Harry Mankini \n\nA fast tempo piece that was written as a joke. Embraced by critics, it is now part of standard repertoire for all pianists.
By: Peaches Doriek \n\nRaymundo sews himself to a blimp and pilots it into the stratosphere.
By: Mindy Fox \n\nLooking good is an art, and so is speaking well. Become influential, irresistible, and inspiring with Mindy’s tips.
Charisma Vol 3: The Art of Diplomacy
By: Dimitry Hard \n\nWith some simple exercises and a little bit of reading, even the worst communicator will know what to say after this!
By: Addison Beryl \n\nCharisma can be broken down into components, like a science equation. Soon you’ll know the answers to becoming incredibly persuasive!
Charisma Vol 2: The Science of Diplomacy
By: Lou DK \n\nThis book outlines the secrets of great comedy. Great comedy starts in the gut and travels through the bowels until it can no longer be contained!
Comedy Vol 3: Show Them the Pain
By: Murphy Edwards \n\nDo you know any jokes? No? Well lucky for you this book is packed with jokes!
By: David Gene Lawrence \n\nStudies show that 95% of good comedy routines start with the comedian grabbing the microphone. This book walks through a plethora of mic holding techniques.
By: I. M. Smith \n\nAn easy piece that helps beginners get a good grasp of piano basics.
By: Orville Bryant \n\nBryant wrote this piece as an homage to his homeless days. The listener gets to explore all of his deep emotions without any of the deep smells. Fabulouse!
By: Dominick VanDeesel \n\nThe antihero from Total Dark blasts off to a strange new world, encountering an alien race that seems to have a lot of questions for him.
By: Stan Shady \n\nThis book outlines more advanced cooking techniques with a special section on the importance of food coloring.
Cooking Vol 3: I'm Here to Cook!
By: Stan Shady \n\nThe beginner's guide to Cooking. This book covers basic techniques and teaches the importance of adding random spices to your dishes.

By: Mimi Morebread \n\nIn the anti-grain age of the gluten free, renowned baker Mimi Morebread reclaims the undeniable power of flour in 13 fabulous recipes that will leave your guests bloated with joy.
By: Stan Shady \n\nLearn to quickly and efficiently produce delicious and chemically pure meals that will have the whole neighborhood fiending for more!
By: Emily C. Skwaird \n\nBoth a personal trainer and a physicist, Emily uses her knowledge to examine what it really takes to get a body in motion.
By: Donna Trymie \n\nFrom client meetings to one-on-ones with your boss, Trymie delivers the skinny on what (not) to wear, eye contact, backslapping and more for success in the modern workplace.
Commando: How to Ensure All Eyes Are on You

By: Golly Zees \n\nAre you chronically tired? Not getting enough sleep? In this new bestseller, Golly Zees discloses the secrets of sleeping standing up. Catch up on rest anytime, anywhere--and tackle each day bright-eyed and bushy-tailed.

By: Meomi Here \n\nBody language can be hard to read, so why not learn to send clearer signals? In her sensual and exciting new book, Meomi Here teaches you inviting new poses such as Bye-Bye Booty, Aloha Allure, and Forget-My-Lats Not.

By: Cutter Cheese \n\nExplore the fabulous world of flatulence! Did you know farting can be an expression of gratitude? Whether you’re going for stealthy stink-bombs or crowd-stopping toots, this easy-to-follow guide can help anyone master the art of the fart.

By: Slip D. Mine \n\nDo you aspire to do magic, but can’t remember the tricks? This amazing magic book is packed with easy-to-execute tricks, repeated over and over and over again just in case you forget. Do you aspire to do magic, but can’t remember the tricks? Read this!
By: Ernest Melville \n\nThe final step in becoming one of the world’s greatest fishermen is to learn how the fish thinks, only then will you be able to catch all the fish in the sea!
Fishing Vol 3: See the Fish, Be the Fish
By: Ernest Melville \n\nSo you want to catch a fish? Learn how to tie a simple fishing knot and cast the line with this beginner’s fishing book.
By: Ernest Melville \n\nYou’re past the basics and now you’ve got some bigger fish to fry! Learn how with this practical guide to buying the right gear and perfecting your methods.
By: Arnold Press \n\nThis book can teach you the techniques to obtain the body of your dreams and your competitor's nightmares!
By: Ori Warrior \n\nMaybe it's about time you took an interest in your physical fitness? Maybe you don't need to finish that 3rd milkshake?
Fitness Vol 1: Put Down the Milkshake
By: Python Pudziakowski \n\nNo, Python is world's strongest. Maybe after reading this though, you can be second strongest.
By: Leslie Nighttime \n\nWhile parts of this saucy novel contain examples of your more typical treachery, the vast majority of this treachery is completely untamed!
By: Agatha Arlington \n\n1950s housewives face off in this intense back stabbing, passive-aggressive drama. Gossip abounds, and claws come out, but always with a polka dot apron and a smile.

By: Mary Sue Arthur \n\nLove! Passion! Unconventional uses for household objects! Are you prepared for the lewd, saucy, tawdry, bawdy, and licentious things a first time author and her trusty thesaurus can make up? If so, read on!
Twelve or so Swatches of WooHoo

By: Hank Billabong \n\nThis multifaceted book gives the ultimate advice for chauvinist fishermen looking to reel in women and fish; both just require the right bait and they fall at your feet! Amazing!
By: Alberto Peperoncini \n\nWho knew the violin could make such music? This piece uses advanced bowing techniques and really grabs the interest of the audience!

By: Helmuth Von Gluck\n\nA rainy night. An old mansion. A dinner party for the toast of Hergstrom's upper crust. It was meant to be a night of good food, drinks, and parlor games. But when certain secrets are revealed the party must contend with an uninvited guest--MURDER!

By: Batty Typer \n\n"I think I can't" is the motto of this children’s story that will help prepare your child for a life of obstacles, disappointment, and ultimately, failure. A somber reminder that there are only winners because there are losers.
By: Aldo Baccarin \n\nThis upbeat piece comes from Brazil, much like the wood used to make violin bows.
By: Slim and Karen Bulger \n\nThe famous songbirds show you how to impress your friends at karaoke or at least stop making their heads hurt.
Piano Bars and You: How to Hold a Note Without a Paper Bag
By: Larry Von Cookiecrumbs \n\nA smooth piece that encourages the player to experiment with vibrato speed in order to convey the right emotion. Only a true violinist can master this piece.
By: Veronica Hunkers \n\nAn intense piece that keeps much of the contact near the frog of the bow. Ribbit!
By: Dr. T. Cress \n\nLearn to use your knowledge of botany and phytotomy to create an army of twisted hybrid superplants! Or apples that taste like peaches. Really either is fine.
Gardening Vol 3: Strange and Forbidden Plant Genetics
By: Wacky Daniel \n\nLearn to plant stuff! Why? BECAUSE I'M WAAAAAAACKYY!
Gardening Vol 1: Water, Light and Dirt
By: Wacky Daniel \n\nGardening is important. It can save your life. Never trust a Sim who ignores a plant's advice.
Gardening Vol 2: Getting Your Thumbs Green
By: Chef Morimochi \n\nLearn to redefine your definition of "food" and fully embrace the gourmet!
Gourmet Cooking Vol 3: Can You Eat That?
By: Martha Brown \n\nAn introductory look into food garnishing and the aesthetics of drastically reducing your portion size.
Gourmet Cooking Vol 1: Make Food Fancy
By: Martha Brown \n\nPresentation is king, and aroma is queen. Texture is a rook and color palette is a bishop. Oh, and taste is like, a knight maybe?
Gourmet Cooking Vol 2: Presentation is King
By: Slim Pickens \n\nWhile there are some advanced picking techniques covered in this book, the majority focuses on treating your crazy shredding-induced, third-degree finger burns.
By: Slim Pickens \n\nDo you have what it takes to rock so hard it actually removes your audience's socks?
By: Slim Pickens \n\nThe secret to a great guitar player is having a strong understanding of classical guitar techniques. That, and having a really awesome guitar.
By: Sparky "Three Fingers" \n\nWhy pay "experts" to fix your broken appliances? Why buy furniture made by "professionals"? You got this.
Handiness Vol 1: Try Not to Die!
By: Sparky "Three Fingers" \n\nLearn to wield the power of electricity and craft wooden versions of things that really have no business being made of wood!
Handiness Vol 2: Sparks are Nature's Kisses
By: Sparky "Three Fingers" \n\nCould the right upgrade ever make a home appliance come to life? Could it learn to love? Sometimes I get lonely.

By: Biggles Tall \n\nA harrowing account of the search for the most dreaded weather phenomenon. More dangerous than tornados, quad-rainbows lure you in with their beauty and then, like unseen ninjas, totally wreck your face. No one knows how they do this... yet.
By: Sin Hartley \n\nThe dead have returned, and they are in no particular hurry to eat your brains!!

By: Honcho Sorgensen \n\nTiny Tino and Gina are in love, but Gina bends to pressure and marries another. Devastated, Tiny Tino finds solace in a love affair with sandwiches of all shapes, sizes, and flavors. Many years later, Gina becomes a widow. Can she love Tino again? Especially now when he isn’t so tiny?
Love in the Time of Sandwiches
By: Ryan Brand \n\nWhy shrug when you can hug? Illuminating the idea that sharing is caring, people learn that ruining things in the future doesn't matter when you’re happy now!
By: Zane Trollins \n\nIt's another death arena in another near-future apocalypse as a young woman must battle to... Wait a second, how many parodies of this did we make?
By: Elias South \n\nA collection of delirious poems written by one man after successfully eating a hogshead barrel full of bacon. Not to be mistaken with the political manifesto of the same name.

By: Elena Buchholz \n\nThis piece was written as an homage to Buchholz's cat, Fiona. She loved music and swayed her tail to the beat whenever Elena played. Whenever Fiona is misbehaving, Buchholz plays this pizzicato.
By: George Vandalay \n\nIt all began the day that Flippy the Narwhal received her first set of finger paints...
By: Genevieve Serene \n\nKids, this story involves corgis, a slap bet, and a convincing Bella Goth imposter. Buckle up!
By: Zachary Quinn \n\nA mountain-sized glob of coconut pudding is lobbed into orbit to study its potential for sustaining life on other planets.

By: Sir Woof \n\nSir Woof is the World’s Most Gentlemanly Corgi, a title bestowed by the Distinguished Canine Society. Never one to slobber or gobble his food, he always looks elegant in his top hat, bow tie, and well-groomed fur.

By: Ace Montegue \n\nShamed by the pirate community solely for his name, Pink Ruffles sailed the seas with his trusty crew. Vitamin C infused cotton candy kept the crew free of scurvy and teeth. Follow Pink Ruffles and crew as they search for treasure and ultimately... redemption.

By: Pete Corgi \n\nImagine the surprise when overnight a horn springs straight up from the middle of a horse's forehead! The former horse named Moon is now on a quest to find out what happened to her, and to see if there are any others of her kind.
By: Gary Clyde \n\nThe sentence you are reading right now is false.
Logic Vol 3: The Problem with Paradoxes
By: Stephen McLackney \n\nLogic has been studied for thousands of years by some of the most brilliant minds. This book tries to sum it all up in a few chapters. Seem reasonable?
Logic Vol 1: An Introduction to Reason
By: Becky Rose \n\nA more indepth look at all things deductive, inductive and abductive. Unfortunately, abductive reasoning has nothing to do with aliens.
Logic Vol 2: The Reason to Reason
By: Lauren Bear \n\nThe most important part of the long con is not forgetting you're doing a long con. This book is jam packed with tips and tricks for all your con needs.
By: Henry Hank \n\nThis book will teach you the basics of becoming a mischievous prankster! Or was that the first prank!? No it wasn't.
Mischief Vol 1: What's Funny, What's Illegal?
By: "Sneaky" Pete Shadow \n\nHow far is "too far" to take a prank? Do we draw the line at tears? Yeah, tears feels right.
Mischief Vol 2: What's Illegal, What's Frowned Upon?
By: Geoff S.S. Marlin \n\nA 9-book trilogy, massively abridged into one confusing volume!
A Game of Musical Chairs: A Song of Hot and Cold

By: Helmuth Von Gluck \n\nIf you see trouble, act upon it and tell the constable. That's how things are supposed to go in Hergstrom. However, the fog is thick in the town by the bay and devious dealings are afoot. How can you watch for murder when the fog is this thick?

By: Helmuth Von Gluck \n\nIt's spring in Hergstrom, which means park outings, going to the beach, and photography. But what happens when a selfie taken with a smart phone reveals more than its owner intended? Murder. Murder is what happens.
By: Helmuth Von Gluck \n\nRed lips sink ships, at least in Hergstrom they do. Can Liz Schultz put the lid on this case before the criminal smears the facts?
By: Shelly Silverman \n\nA brilliantly light-hearted collection of poems that proves that a kid's life is a day at the beach.

By: Thomas Hinkle \n\nIn a post-apocalyptic city, 9 teenagers are chosen at random from their cave communities to eat until they are stuffed. Then, they waddle onto the Field of Terrors and fight to the death. Why? THE FUTURE!!
By: George Harold Innman \n\nIn another heart-pounding international thriller, our favorite secret agent has to navigate hypochondria in order to prevent nuclear war.
By: Sara DeVere \n\nA great painter is defined by their ability to put paint on canvas and then talk about that paint in an emotional way that non-painters don't understand.
Painting Vol 3: The Painting of Painting
By: Siggy Sue \n\nLearn some basic brush techniques as well as some pretentious vocabulary to use at art galleries.
Painting Vol 1: The Fundamentals of Painting
By: Seamus Shanty \n\nStudy the cave painting of old to the modern paintings of today. The more work you've seen the more work you'll be able to "reference."
Painting Vol 2: The History of Painting
By: Hamlin Steinkey \n\nLearn to play like a professional and move the audience to tears, smiles, or frowns with your masterful performance!
Piano Vol 3: Concertos, Minutes, and Sonatas
By: Hamlin Steinkey \n\nWhether you're just generally interested in learning the piano or your parents are forcing you to, this book will teach you the basics.
Piano Vol 1: It's Pretty Black and White
By: Hamlin Steinkey \n\nA comprehensive resource for every budding pianist! Learn all the little details involved with piano playing!
Piano Vol 2: Sharps, Flats, and Naturals

By: Jim Scuttleson \n\nWhen humble family man Ira Strauss left the big city to start a farm, he never expected to find a dead French diplomat face-down in the hay. Can Ira's uncanny nose for detail and way with livestock help catch the killer before the FBI tears his barn apart? First in the epic Ira Strauss mystery series!
Programming Vol 3: Learn to Talk Robot
By: James Scott \n\nBecome a computer wizard! Not a wizard like hat and wand, just someone who can bend computers to their will. Actually, a hat and wand couldn’t hurt.
Programming Vol 1: Turn It Off and On Again
By: Rich Raken \n\nThis book will teach you the importance of using fibers to keep your multithreaded code clean, healthy, and ready for anything.
By: Professor Sprocket \n\nThis last installment comes with a 100% guarantee that after reading this you’ll be able to construct and launch a spacecraft!
Rocket Science Vol 3: Counting Down to Launch
By: Professor Sprocket \n\nAn easy introduction into aerospace engineering. It shouldn’t be too hard to learn, after all this isn’t rocket science…oh wait, yes it is.
Rocket Science Vol 1: So You Want to Be a Rocket Scientist
By: Professor Sprocket \n\nEverything you need to know about thrusters, escape velocity, fluid mechanics, and more.
Rocket Science Vol 2: The Nuts and Bolts of Constructing Your Spacecraft

By: Missy Brood \n\nAbandoned by her parents, Sara Petit has little hope of ever finding what she dreams of most: a loving home. Until the day she is adopted by a remarkably smothering woman, at which point she misses the orphanage.
By: George Vandalay \n\nOne is light gray. Another is slate. And there's a charcoal one. Two others are light black and dark white.
By: Mabel Eloise Clift \n\nThis tightly edited collection of post-modern verse prizes brevity over the verbosity of longer forms, like haiku.

By: Lucas Dark \n\nThis gripping mystery tells the tale of Lucas Dark, an exceedingly attractive author with nothing left to lose but his mind. Written by future award winner Lucas Dark, this--but wait, that's the main character's name too! What a coincidence!
Lucas Dark and The Increasingly Unlikely Series of Coincidences

By: Bella Jacobs \n\nThis is the classic that started it all! Supernatural romance at its best! Young Darla must decide between a bad-boy vampire and a nice werewolf boy who is friends with her dad. Guess who she picks!!
By: Island Hatchley \n\n30 Sims are locked inside a giant mansion with no toilets. Who will come away clean?
By: Adrien Chappuis\n\nSurprise your listeners with the Impromptu Impromptu! This piece is so scattered and lacking in any coherent theme that it takes impromptus to a whole new level. META!
By: Larry Von Cookiecrumbs \n\nAfter going blind from staring at the sun, Larry took to the piano and wrote this piece. Sadly it did not make his hearing more acute, as he had suspected.
By: Gene Damage \n\nIn this epic saga of post-apocalyptic survival, a child finds herself alone on a ruined planet, with no one but her fish to comfort her.
By: Johnny Primo \n\nWhat if we're all just characters in some kind of sick, real life video game?
Video Gaming Vol 3: The Game of Life
By: Johnny Primo \n\nLearn to dish out an obnoxious blend of profanity and sarcasm to complete strangers all from the comfort and safety of your home!
Video Gaming Vol 1: Trolling for n00bs
By: Johnny Primo \n\nEverything you need to know about games, gaming and gamers. Not covered: hygiene, friendship, self control.
Video Gaming Vol 2: The Official Guide to Gaming
By: Cade Noten \n\nSure you can play the violin but have you ever used your power to bring an audience to tears? It's actually really satisfying.
By: Stringy Banner \n\nInterested in learning the violin? Great! If you don't succeed as a concert violinist, you can always play in the subways for a few bucks on the side!
By: Strata \n\nThis book covers medium to advanced violin head bobbing and the ever-coveted "playing with eyes closed to enhance feeling" technique.
By: Edward Falon Toaster \n\nThis book will teach you to dig into your disturbed subconscious and pull out some really dark stuff. Just be sure to write with the lights on. Spooky!
By: Rosie and Robbie Luteces \n\nLive, Lived, Will Live. Die, Died, Will Die. Flummox, Flummoxed, Will Flummox.
By: Billy Shakes \n\nDid you know you can lengthen your written works by increasing the point size of just your periods? Longer is always better in the literary world.
Writing Vol 2: The Importance of Punctuation

Long before the shortly armed bipedal tyrants met their fate at the whims of a fiery rock or icy cold, these reptilian beasts strutted their stuff just beyond the primordial soup. With informative pictures and rhyming scientific names, Rex Treks is a journey to days a million past for children eager to take their first step in the fossil record.

There are times in a farmer’s life when they know that their one pig is not just some pig but the fun pig. Charlotte’s Pig is the charming, triumphant morality tale of a pig who teaches their owner that sometimes, you just need to look around and smell the bacon.

Journey at night to the woods and the thicket where Baby Bill and the Bobcat are in a sticky wicket. Parents will love BB and the B’s strong use of natural insights and subtle commentary on the modern industrial complex, whereas children will delight at the pages’ fluffy texture.

In the quiet town of Hannawee, a lonely family finds their hearts swollen with sadness when the rainy seasons begin. But, atop the log on the flooded river, a mysterious Dog on a Log arrives, and none of their lives will ever be the same.

Monkey Brown went up the bars and oops he fell and broke his thars. What should Monkey Brown have learned as a result of this handle-barred hiccup, and were the parents to blame? You won’t be able to stop this true crime (or is it a true accident?!) page turner of a toddler thriller.

Is it spring? Not now, but soon. Is it fall? Perhaps, by noon? Is it summer? The heat, seems likely. When is winter? Who knows, but it’s coming.

Before the younglings are ready for curves, straight lines, or fewer than four sides, we have Squares…and you! Squares and You is the Award-Winning landmark educational title that knocked Geometry in the Womb off its well-accolated perch and told Rhombus Rompus to take a hike!

In a world where we’re all unique snowflakes, it’s good to remind toddlers that sometimes they have more in common with others than their differences. Before beautiful hair grows, and muscles form, soft, plushy toddlers are all bald little similarities. Embrace it, at least for now.
