Look to the lower atmosphere! What do you see? Is it a choo choo careening off the rails? Or a wanton bear looking for artisanal honey? No, it’s MaxisMan and he’s here to save the day!

Imagine a world in which the sandbox isn’t just filled with cold, lifeless toys, but vibrantly alive with ones that speak and emote! It’s all here in Toy Tales, a heartwarming story about how a young girl’s toys tell her how to reach for her dreams.

Put on your space suit little stumpy moon ranger and hop into the space boat because the whole family is going to Mars! In this charming picture book of our solar system, join along with Mary, Pete, and Squeazy Tom as they explore the Milky Way, and beyond, beginning with Mars in this first installment.
A small book of children's stories.
A screenplay. For your eyes only!
Doing homework is an important step toward getting good grades.
Filled with invisible notes that play a distinct melody....
By: Julio Kid \n\nA culinary master’s inside guide to creating the perfect dish and achieving perfect reviews from the toughest of food critics.
By: Blaire Aparti \n\nA complete guide to entertaining and being entertained!
How to Be a Successful Socialite
A box filled with rewards! As you complete milestones in the Positivity Challenge aspiration, you can collect rewards from this box. Or search within, and see what hidden gems you may discover.
Must Speak with Millie Bobby Brown to unlock the Box of Kindness.
Given for starting the Positivity Challenge

Clutter is the albatross around the neck of your soul. Yet, the Harbinger cabinet allows you to walk the clear path, unencumbered. Stylish and sleek, it is the perfect fashionable possession to hold all your other fashionable possessions, making it seem, to the mind of the soul, as if you only have one fashionable possession. Sweet freedom!

Modern convenience meets vintage style in this kitchen cabinet set that’s as tall on class as it is in height. Designed to impersonate an all-wood cabinet, this remarkable piece is constructed of rehabilitated recycled particle board and contains three interior shelves for maximum storage.
Keep your clutter on the down low, concealed between stately paneled cabinet doors. Such style, such luxury.

Give your kitchen an edge with this sleek modular cabinet. With just enough room for your basic essentials, this compact unit is ideal for kitchenettes and intimate modern spaces. Low in height, shallow in depth, with no exterior handles whatsoever, the BlandCo Contemporary Cabinet is functional design at its purest.
These modular cabinets deck your walls in industrial good looks, utility with distressed wood finishes, and raw metal trim and framing.

Nothing shows off your mind for strategy like the Chessmaster indoor/outdoor chess table. Complete with hand-carved, dramatically styled stone pieces, this 27” table shows you’re up for a challenge anytime, from anyone. Store the pieces in the concealed drawer if you’d rather just drink your coffee.

Fresh air is the secret to ferocious focus, so we made it easy to take your chess game outside. Come sit under the stars, play with your kings and knights, and dream of the battles you’ll win time and again.
Chess under the Stars Patio Table

This elegant, hand-carved pedestal table features an inset stone playing surface, complete with matching chess pieces. Locate some chairs and a worthy opponent, and enjoy hour after hour of intellectual play. Or, just leave it about and look smarter.

Lil' Jony was a household name in the chimney business by this time, and it was well known that in order to keep her, and her greased pig, far from danger, a chimney cap was a required piece for the protection of all.
Durable double chimney made of reinforced concrete. Boxy and no-nonsense.
A practical and durable concrete chimney with a triangular metal cap.
A wide concrete chimney topped with a metal cap.
A wide brick chimney plus metal cap to keep birds and bats at bay.

A chimney is that extra little bit of construction that completes a look and adds a touch of class to any house. It’s like a necktie for your roof! And our deluxe, mission-tile crested Mega Chimney is like the designer brand silk necktie of chimneys. Hang/place one on your neck/roof today!

At MegaMission Outdoor Warehouse, we know that the quality of your chimney says a lot about your home. Our chimneys are manufactured from Doe-bee, our proprietary adobe substitute, and topped with one of our synthetic minerals, Ayurn or Coppur, or our synthetic alloy, Brahnz.
A tall no-frills chimney with triangular cap.
The archetypal chimney made of brick set with cement. Sweep not included.
The large bricks and curved silhouette of this chimney provide a modern twist on an old classic.
Combines modern chimney safety and classic styling in a tall cool package.
A simple lump of clay awaits you.

Nothing sends shivers of excitement up your back like the warm, cheery chime of the Dear Old Grandfather Clock. Run to it, reach out and feel its scintillating vibrations. Dear Old Grandfather will never know.

Handcrafted with uncompromising workmanship, this solid oak clock is the perfect complement to your mission-style furniture, and never ever forgets its own mission: to chime the hour, every hour, right on time.

Pardon me, do you have the time? Or does time have you? Make a bold statement in the ownership of time with The Sentinel from Reclamation Homeware, a fully functional clock made 100% from reclaimed garbage.
Unlock by reaching level 4 of the Tech Guru career.
Unlocked at level 4 of the Tech Guru career.

Adorn your wall with the thorny beauty of the Brazen Time wall clock. With a round, open face that will never sag and hands that will never tire, this clock defies the very master it should be serving: Time. And given all those spikes, Time doesn’t argue.

Ah, memory. As the dainty hands of time tick relentlessly on, Remembrance’s golden curves draw you back to brighter days, when every second felt like an eternal dream from which you never wished to wake. Alarm clock optional.

This industrial steel wall clock looks virtually indestructible, and it is if it doesn’t fall off your exposed brick wall, onto whatever industrial-grade flooring you probably have to go with it. So hang it well, k?

Hey, parents! Here’s a cool way to teach your kids how to tell time even when your tablet’s battery is dead! Tiny mechanical “hands” slowly rotate around the clock, pointing to the numbers representing the current time. Funducational!
Did you know that a 12-sided polygon is called a dodecagon? Now you do. Makes sense for a clock with no numbers, don’t you think?

Coffee makers come with a variety of different functions and abilities. It can be hard to choose the best one. Ours come in a variety of pretty colors. Looks like your choice just got a lot easier. Introducing: The Schmapple Coffee. It’s Coffee, to the Power of You.

This is a premium brew-station for connoisseurs who understand that coffee is a LIFESTYLE, not some bitter swill that only serves as a dunking place for one’s donuts. Our machine brews fine coffee, for fine men and women. Fine pastries can be enjoyed with, but never IN, our coffee. Enjoy an Immodéré life!

Are you someone who really, really loves coffee? Well, you might want to consider buying the Joe Jockey anyway. It has a feature that squirts hot water over coffee grounds, producing a lightly browned liquid. Is it fancy? No. Does it get the job done? Let’s say “Sure.”

Caffeine: a popular pick-me-up in the fields of technology and law enforcement, this wonderful substance can be brewed in your own kitchen thanks to the Caffeininator! Delivered via a hot brown liquid, it's sure to give you the pep you crave! Get Caffeininated!
Sleek, smooth, and impeccably crafted, this heat-regulating coffeepot has enough processing power to put a high-end computer to shame! For cuisiniers and techies alike.
Unlock by reaching level 3 of the Culinary career or level 2 of the Tech Guru career, or by completing a Dinner Party at Gold level.
Unlocked at level 3 of the Culinary career or level 2 of the Tech Guru career, or at Gold level of the Dinner Party.
Alabaster is a milky white stone that is soft and smooth to the touch.
Like delicious citrus fruits, Citrine colors range from pale yellow to golden. Perhaps that color is why it’s thought to bring success and prosperity!
These uncommon opals are generally found in volcanic rock formations and are prized for their shifting warm, fiery colors.
Because of its somber coloring Jet is commonly used in mourning jewelry, but it isn’t commonly known that Jet is actually fossilized wood!
While Plumbites are found in varying shades from red to yellow to green, it’s most popular hue is a deep, bright green.
Quartz was once believed to be ice crystals that would never melt, but now we know it’s made of silicon–oxygen tetrahedra. Duh.
Named for its pale pink color, Rose quartz is the stone of unconditional love and exudes a soothing sense of tranquility.
Sought after for their brilliant red hues, rubies represent the passion of love. Decorating your slippers with them do not allow you to teleport.
Shinolite is the shiniest stone of them all! Be careful looking at it as you might just get hypnotized by its gleaming silver beauty.
Turquoise is an opaque, blue-to-green stone that has been prized for centuries, as many believe it brings protection and good fortune.
Amethysts are purple colored quartz! From soft lilac to royal violet, these purple shades are caused by iron impurities in the stone.
Often used in jewelry, these sparkling gems are some of the most valued in the world and are also the hardest known natural material!
Emerald literally means green gem, and the gorgeous green color of emeralds are unparalleled! Having one will surely make others green with envy!
Even though Hematite has a black metallic luster on the outside, it has a dark, blood red color on the inside.
Jonquilyst is like a glittering drop of sunshine! Its bright, yellow color radiates cheerfulness.
Being relatively abundant and durable, Orange Topaz is a very popular gemstone! With its happy color, it can be a symbol of friendship.
This small stone is delicate in size with a demure, peachy-pink color. No wonder it is the embodiment of innocence.
Rainborz is a rare and unusual gemstone that is multi-colored, but predominantly red. And strangely, it is frequently found near rainbows!
Bluer than the sky, Sapphire is a sight to behold! Known as the gem of truth, it helped coin the phrase "true blue."
Simanite is one of the few stones with a true silver color. It has been used in everything from alchemy to utensil polishing.
A beautifully decorated egg. Make your friends envious, be the talk of the town.
Proudly display your element collection on this official Geo Council rack. Now with inert magnetic snap-slots.
Alcineat, chemical symbol An, is a member of the elite Royal Liquids, which have strong colors but no odor. It was discovered in the 50's when someone found a puddle of it in her backyard.
Goobleck, chemical symbol Vg, is a member of the elite Royal Liquids, which have strong colors but no odor. Goobleck has been scientifically proven to have the best name out of all elements.

Melacoo, chemical symbol Q, is a member of the elite Royal Liquids, which have strong colors but no odor. For a long time Melacoo was actually thought to be Sydrolin, but those scientists were just lazy.

Phozone, chemical symbol Pz, is a member of the elite Royal Liquids, which have strong colors but no odor. The scientist that discovered Phozone really loved broth, noodles, and meat with just a touch of carrots, which she often ate while doing experiments.
Plathium, chemical symbol Pl, is a member of the elite Royal Liquids, which have strong colors but no odor. Plathium looks a lot like lemonade but tastes more like horrible choking death.
Sydrolin, chemical symbol Sy, is a member of the elite Royal Liquids, which have strong colors but no odor. While Sydrolin looks like grape juice, please do not drink Sydrolin. Seriously.
Crytacoo is prized for its legendary durability. It's so strong, it can't even be manipulated by modern tools. It just has to be found in usable shapes!
Very little is known about the element Firaxium. It simply does not grant very many interviews.
Wolfium is a strange element notorious for its smell, which for some reason is similar to that of a wet dog.

Oxypin is a member of the Transition Ores. The scientist who discovered this group of metals was going through some tough times, hence the name Transition Ores. Oxypin is blue, which represents the scientist’s sorrow.
Ozinate is a member of the Transition Ores. They say just a sprinkle of it can help make casserole night a family favorite again!
Peryllium, chemical symbol Ll, is a beautiful pink Orelloid. Many describe it as something that could only come from a unicorn’s magic, and that's scientists talking!
Trying to describe Plumbobus is like trying to bite your own neck. It is impossible! Plumbobus is so unique. It is… amazing.
Selium is a member of the Transition Ores -- not the ironic ska/country fusion band of the same name, but rather the group of elements.
Volenton is a beautiful purple Orelloid. It occurs naturally in deposits of volcanic rock and in rib-based fast food sandwiches.
A sneaky predator fish that lures prey into its mouth with a small, glowing tentacle-like growth on its head.
A good sized fish known in Celtic mythology as a symbol of wisdom. Also known for being delicious.
Sturgeon are large fish sometimes called living fossils. Luckily, they aren't offended.
This bottom feeding eel-like fish is known its hard-shell eating teeth. Scared? They're actually quite friendly.
A sneaky predator fish that lures prey into its mouth with a small, glowing tentacle like growth on its head.
A perch by another name. Nice sound dynamics though.
The batfish doesn't sleep upside-down, but it has nice, leathery wings to make up for it.
Unlike a domestic cat, this fish uses its whiskers to taste its surroundings. Like thin little tongues.
Koi is actually a shortening of nishikigoi meaning"brocaded carp." A pretty name for a pretty fish.
Contrary to popular belief, following a rainbowfish will not lead you to a pot of goldfish.
Tilapia are a type of cichlid fish. They're pretty happy in a nice aquarium too.
Shhh... can you hear their singing? No? Well, even magical treefish have limits.
It might look like a little bit like salmon, but no doubt it's trout.
You won’t get a record weight with this fish, but everyone will be looking to hear the story on how you caught this spooky friend.
This is one sweet treat that you’ll want to avoid taking a bite out of.
He swims in circles, can’t remember a thing, and is already dead… your best friend!
A deliciously squishy friend for your home, just don’t leave him alone with the catfish.
A lovely small fish, perfect for showing off and keeping other fish on their best behavior.
A very small and hardy fish, that's betta than most!
A small member of the carp family known to frequent both fishbowls and toilet bowls.
A small, bright tropical fish. (Not only bright as in colorful--they're also pretty smart.)
Don't kiss these lips; perch have sharp rows of teeth lining their mouth.
A fish so small, it's best used to catch other fish.
A small spiny fish typically found in rivers and lakes.
A small fish with big bite. But really, watch out for those tiny teeth.
A small fish with a big name. Also known as a redtail sharkminnow.
A small freshwater fish with a compressed, shiny body and distinctive fins.

Eons ago, in an era when things were way more awesome, a powerful wizard sailed the seas battling sea monsters. One such monster thought he finally had the drop on the wizard, only to find himself turned to stone and sinking to the ocean floor.
This claw's owner was a pack hunter, so her attack would come not from the front, but from the side -- from the other two raptors you didn't even know were there. Clever girl.
While this egg will never hatch, one can still wonder if there is a baby dinosaur hidden inside or if it is just the undeveloped yolk of a giant, pre-historic mega-chicken.
Wax paper didn't exist a long time ago. When cavepeople found a leaf they liked, they instead encased it in clay, dried it out and then displayed it next to their mammoth-fur rugs.

T-rex arms were once considered good luck. People wore them on charm bracelets, key chains, and hung them from vehicle mirrors. Science has confirmed the arms bear no lucky properties, but it was still pretty lucky to find two!
This fossilized hand serves as a somber reminder that excessive and overzealous high-fiving can lead to tragedy.

An ancient caveman preserved animal footprints as a hobby, displaying them in a popular museum-cave for all the other cavepeople to cave-enjoy. What an amazing convenience it was for modern anthropologists to find these preserved footprints all in one place!
Trilobite means three lobes. It does not mean being bit at a strength three times a normal bite. If that were the case, arthropods would be terrifying!

In prehistoric times rocks were shaped like sharp little triangles, which ancient hunters would use to catch food. Over time people began to plant, farm, and raise livestock. They had no more need for these rocks, and so the rocks evolved into the smooth blobs we see today.

This is a near-perfect preservation of Raptor Erraticus, which was known to fly in random, crazy patterns to distract predators. A downside to this particular defense was that the bird often flew into trees or rocks and was immediately killed.
This fossil marks the passing of an ancient gentleman of true class. A gentleman who fell face-first into some ancient mud.

Australosimicus afarensis, or "Pre-Pre-Pre Sim," lived between 3.9 and 2.9 million years ago! Not that WHOLE time, of course, that's just a range of possible… Look, this is a rare find and it should be treasured!
This could be the evidence needed to confirm that there are other forms of life in the universe!! Or it could be papier mache -- science has no way of telling!
This fossil has stumped experts from every conventional scientific discipline. No one knows what it really is.

Every scientist knows that prehistoric cows had rows of jagged teeth like a mako shark. No wonder, then, that their udders evolved to be very tough. That's why this specimen is almost perfectly preserved eons after these gentle giants roamed the world.
Time has not been kind to what's left of these bones. This fossil has fragmented into several pieces.
A deposit of sedimentary earth and stone containing strange traces of foreign particles
The Spotted Leaf Frog is mottled with cute, green freckles. In high school, it was voted “Most Likely to Be a Rockstar.”
The Spotted Heart Frog is adorned with pimple-like red dots. It can hula hoop with bent reeds.
The Leopard Frog is dotted with mustard-colored specks. It aspires to a career in politics.
The Striped Leaf Frog’s rich, green stripes echo lily pad leaves. When in love, it makes the sound of a trombone.
The Common Striped Heart Frog’s back is stamped with a bright, red line. Never wake it up before 10 a.m. (It's a total grumpus.)
The Tiger Frog’s sunshine-colored stripes lend to its cat-like appearance. Single old lady ducks keep Tiger Frogs around as company.
The Surfer Leaf Frog has a calming, green wave pattern on its spine. A certified accountant, it’s most commonly spotted during tax season.
The Heartsurfer Frog is known for its coat of distinct red waves. Romance novels are its favorite literary genre.
The Sunsurfer Frog sports a splashy, yellow wave pattern. It sunburns easily and always wears SPF 50.
This organism's vital fluids contain traces of phosphorus, glowing for a short period of time when exposed to oxygen. The next "fossil" fuel?
Extracted from the body of its prior host, the specimen continues to move even after other life signs have long since faded.
Preliminary readings suggest that this "skeleton" emits a constant stream of short-wave transmissions--often involving what appear to be numerical tallies.
With six appendages, partial transparency, and an unusually reflective outer membrane, this specimen likely evolved on a water-planet before arriving at the point of discovery.
Anatomical analysis reveals that this specimen has both reptilian and mammalian reproductive features--perfectly fit for erratic meteorological patterns.

This collectible display comes complete with a plaque, some wood, and a hefty pile of alcron. Show off your collecting prowess proudly and let everyone know that you don't just collect some things, you collect all of them.

This collectible display comes complete with a plaque, some wood, and a hefty pile of Baconite. Show off your collecting prowess proudly and let everyone know that you don't just collect some things, you collect all of them.

This collectible display comes complete with a plaque, some wood, and a hefty pile of death metal. Show off your collecting prowess proudly and let everyone know that you don't just collect some things, you collect all of them.

This collectible display comes complete with a plaque, some wood, and a hefty pile of elegant flamingonium. Show off your collecting prowess proudly and let everyone know that you don't just collect some things, you collect all of them.

This collectible display comes complete with a plaque, some wood, and a hefty pile of literal literalite. Show off your collecting prowess proudly and let everyone know that you don't just collect some things, you collect all of them.

This collectible display comes complete with a plaque, some wood, and a hefty pile of obtainable obtainium. Show off your collecting prowess proudly and let everyone know that you don't just collect some things, you collect all of them.

This collectible display comes complete with a plaque, some wood, and a hefty pile of phozonite. Show off your collecting prowess proudly and let everyone know that you don't just collect some things, you collect all of them.

This collectible display comes complete with a plaque, some wood, and a hefty pile of punium. Show off your collecting prowess proudly and let everyone know that you don't just collect some things, you collect all of them.

This collectible display comes complete with a plaque, some wood, and a hefty pile of pyrite. Show off your collecting prowess proudly and let everyone know that you don't just collect some things, you collect all of them.

This collectible display comes complete with a plaque, some wood, and a hefty pile of socialite. Show off your collecting prowess proudly and let everyone know that you don't just collect some things, you collect all of them.
Crytunium is highly brittle; making it frustratingly hard to work with as it breaks apart easily and is not commonly found.
Furium is highly reactive and flammable compared to other metals. It is prone to outbursts and tarnishes easily.
Heavy Metal like brass is the metal of choice for musical instruments because of its malleability and acoustic properties.
Ironyum is a metal not many understand as it often reacts in the opposite manner of what you would expect.
Ozinold is a dense, heavy metal accidentally discovered by Harold Ozinold and subsequently named after him due to their similar characteristics.
Plathinum is a common transition metal that has a variety of uses since it doesn’t react to most chemicals.
Romantium is a blush-colored metal that is highly reactive chemically; you might even consider it one of the most amorous metals.
Sadnum is a soft, malleable metal that is typically found in a blue state and is as rare as a unicorn’s tear.
Simtanium has a shiny, reflective green appearance and is highly conductive so it is used in the production of computer parts like circuit boards.
Utranium is a metal with a low melting point that was once used as a pigment to dye almost everything purple!
Alcron is a highly abundant silvery, ductile metal which means it doesn’t crack or break under stress as easily!
Baconite is a soft, red colored metal that oddly has a faint smell of juicy, delicious cured pork.
Death Metal is remarkably resistant to corrosion and is speculated to be the material used in the Grim Reaper’s scythe.
Flamingonium is a startling shade of pink and is the go-to metal for creating shiny lawn ornaments.
Literalite is a hard-to-find purple metal that little is known about, and currently its properties are taken at face value.
Obtainium is pale white in color and is also one of the most abundant metals so it is relatively easy to obtain.
Phozonite is a yellow-tinted metal that has good electrical and thermal conductivity, but is famous for its unique atom arrangements.
Punium is a metal just like any other, but it is habitually overlooked and no one takes it seriously. Perhaps because of its name?
Pyrite has a metallic sheen and brassy-yellow color, but you’d have to be a fool to mistake this for real gold!
Socialite is a precious metal that is highly sought after to make attractive and extremely valuable jewelry.
There is no better sidekick than your ol’ pal, Buddy. Supportive, optimistic, and fiercely loyal, he’ll stick by your side through any adventure. Last seen moonlighting as a special agent.
DJ Candy is like a living, breathing dance party that never stops. With her roadies and #1 fans, Zach and Sapphire, she travels the world bringing the party to those who need it most.
Poor Carl. Things have only gotten worse for him since he died. He spends a lot of his time wondering what he’s actually accomplished and basically having an afterlife-crisis.
Chaz McFreely is the world’s greatest extreme sports athlete, according to Chaz McFreely. In his mind there are only two kinds of people: Chaz Fans and Chumps. Which are you?
Dr. F is the indomitable mad scientist with PhDs in robotology AND robotonomy. There are many, many conflicting reports as to what the “F” actually stands for. He invented TOBOR.

Elmira is sour, strict, impatient, and fussy. Her favorite sound is absolute silence and her favorite hobby is toil. On the plus side, um… she’s pretty good at remembering names? That’s something, right?
Gabby’s a cantankerous old grump who lives with his junkyard dog, Grit. He enjoys tinkering with things and getting into feuds with his longtime frenemy Barney. (Sorry there’s no Barney figurine.)
Gino’s skills in a kitchen are matched only by his sense of melodrama. The tiniest thing goes wrong and he’s “ruined.” To date, Gino has been ruined 9,685 times.

Gonk is a happy and hungry little cave-lad from the Uncharted Isle, which strangely can be found on most maps. His best friends are Bobaboo the dinosaur and a dissatisfied grad student named Sylvia, whom he calls “Girl.”

Meet Goth Boy! Nothing makes him feel warmer than wrapping himself in a cloak of emotional darkness. He loves writing bad poetry and hates his job at Turkey-on-a-Fork.\n Wait a second... is "goth" even still a thing??
BOING! RIBBIT! Hopper is a young boy in a frog suit. How did this character get so popular? SPROING!!
Jenny was a fan fiction pioneer! Sure, nowadays EVERYBODY gets a publishing deal or a movie based on their self-published stories, but Jenny’s “Starcruiser X” fanfic was the first!

Leaf is a hardcore elvish rock star and he totally knows it. What many people don’t know is that he still carries a small piece of his baby blanket, which he calls “Blanky,” everywhere he goes. Blanky is Leaf’s oldest and truest friend.

With an insatiable thirst for adventure, Lyndsay always keeps one eye on the horizon. Her contagious energy often sees her friends swept up in her latest quest. May have had a thing for Buddy at some point??

Beyond time and space is a world of black fire. From the heart of this maelstrom of horrors was born the infernal Morcubus!! As president and CEO of MorcuCorp he advances his dark designs, and he also leads team-building workshops.

Poppy is an adorable little ray of sunshine who love love LOVES flowers. She also loves her older sister, Violet, and is completely unaware that she is usually the source of her sister’s constant headaches.
TOBOR has displayed a distinct lack of patience for human beings, or “fleshies,” but with a “dad” like the insane Dr. F can anyone really blame him? Might have a debilitating fear of kelp.
Trevor is a dramatic ac-tor… of WONDERS!! His stirring interpretations of classic works are the very essence of the theatre! One time he got stuck in an astronaut costume.

Dark and dramatic, Violet Nightshade nonetheless has a beautiful heart. She does her best to take care of her kid sister, Poppy, even if it usually gives her one of those headaches that sits right above her eye.
Yuki likes to bite faces. Why? Is it a sign of aggression, or one of affection? We may never know. Her relationship with faces is as complex and mysterious as Yuki herself...

Ever just know something in your bones? That’s because the skeleton can act as an antennae, transmitting info to the brain. In this dinosaur fossil, we see the haunting conduits where bone instinct may have cried out, “Run! METEOR!” Dinosaurs had brains the size of peas. That’s why they all died. Enjoy your painting.

Never fall in love with a plankton. Flowing wherever the current takes them, they are total vagabonds. Here’s one such plankton, dancing with groupies after a night playing electric guitar with the Bacteria Band. Fortunately this moment was captured in art. We’ll never see him again.

They say each snowflake is unique. Up close, these snow crystals, secure in their individual flakiness, appear to be gathering around one deformed snow pyramid, who they will shortly beat up for being TOO different. As this painting reveals, snow is not as gentle as it seems.

Isn't it strange how zooming in on a fossilized leaf actually makes it look similar to a piece of steak? Are plants and animals more alike than they seem? Do leaves also feel love and fear? What does this say about veganism? Should we eat anything at all? Art raises some serious questions.

If there’s one thing we've learned through microscopic explorations into the mineral world it’s this: Rocks sure are trippy! Here we have Dunite, magnified fifty zillion percent and captured in bright tempera. Hang it in a college dorm room!

Magnification reveals interesting facts about microorganisms, such as their preference for bubble gum pink décor and festive streamers hung in their living rooms, all year round. If life on earth were a giant party, microorganisms were the first to arrive, and as this painting reveals, they may be the last to leave!
This compelling artwork captures the plankton hula hoop performance team mid-rehearsal, for a number that will sink into obscurity when, en route to a gig, the entire team is eaten by a turtle.
Don’t have a green thumb? No problem. Enjoy plants at the cellular level, where they’re actually blue—and in art form, where they require no water, sunlight or “Please don’t leave me!” pep talks.

Evoking all the colors of autumn, this mineral painting represents the diminished glow of youth, and the twilight years of life, when all hope is gone, and the path we have taken slides toward its eventual tear-filled end. Hang it in the breakfast nook or the baby's nursery!

Look at the precision fit of these bright cells. No wonder they’re called the “building blocks of life.” In fact, the only difference between toy blocks and living cells is that organisms are not assembled by children. (Except for the platypus; that was built by a third grader named Frank.)

At the crux of hard science and new age woo-woo lies the crystal. Here, we can see both the distinctive crystal geometry, revered by scientists for its electrical, optical and mechanical properties, and the glittery crystal sparkles, known for their harmonic love vibrations and aura cleansing magic.

This artwork chronicles the awkward adolescent stage of plant cell development, where they are tormented by embarrassing acne. Absorbing enough rainwater can really help, and fortunately, a cell can just divide to create its own prom date.

In space, cloudy days trump sunny ones. That's because the clouds are made of green glitter! The sun, on the other hand, is made of fire and radiation. Before visiting space, definitely check the space-weather forecast. Or just stay home and marvel at this painting.

Just imagine this strange world as it would look viewed by an alien returning to its home planet. Oh the longing in that alien's five heart chambers, the tears in its 22 eyes. Back on the surface, it will no longer be “alien.” It will visit its neighborhood bar, where everyone knows its name: “XF2&23%tY.”

Since ancient times, we have scanned the night sky for signs of things to come. This star-spangled horizon contains countless constellations, each of which can be read for information about the future. (The small U.F.O.s under the stars, for example, can be read as a sign of imminent attack.)

A cloud formation looks deceptively like a wandering plesiosaurus, set against a stunning early-evening vista. What might the cloud plesiosaur be searching for? The gentle stratus doesn't answer, but floats on, unaware of its inevitable demise.

Like cars, rockets come in different models. The sleek sports rocket. The SUV soccer mom rocket. And this—a reproduction of an ad for the tricked out luxury sedan rocket. Its style is inversely proportional to its aerodynamic qualities. Get to the moon slower. And look good doing it!

Mars is the red planet. The dirt is red. The air is red. Want to wear blue pants on Mars? Too bad! There are only RED pants on Mars. This painting shows the Mars sky, with its fiery red clouds. Beautiful to an Earthling. Martians, however, have coined the saying, "Let's go out and paint the town green!"

This fantasy painting captures the mythical union of a crystal rock formation with a sizzling comet. Theirs was a love affair that defied gravity, physics and, well, probably several other laws. No one thought it would last. In fact, it didn't. But at least it burned out, before it faded away.

In the X57 region of the 1245P-Brock galaxy, there is a planet populated entirely by giant hamsters. Here, two monster-sized hamster balls glisten in the sun, awaiting the return of their fuzzy inhabitants, who are busy running on a Ferris wheel (not pictured).

Gasses such as helium and hydrogen pool together with interstellar dust to create this riveting, rose-colored nebula. Why ARE gasses and dust so attractive way out there in space? Here on earth, this helium balloon covered in dirt—well, it's just not the same.

Is it a rainbow? A cloud? Stars? You might want to sit down, because it's actually a rainbow-colored cloud filled with stars! If you do not enjoy the unbelievable union of magic things in this painting, well then, sorry there's a cold hunk of obsidian where your heart should be.

Hubba hubba! Check out this glamour shot portrait Saturn had done a few years back, when it went through a divorce and lost all that weight (who's the second largest planet NOW, Uranus?). The slight blue glow really brings out its rings. Rumor has it that it's dating again and has recently attracted a sixty-third moon.
Yup. Here's some space. Looking space-like. It's got the stars. And the dark, gassy looking stuff. And some more stars. Hang it on a wall, to give that wall a real spacey feel.
Oh, no! Someone just flushed the universe. Jiggle the handle! Jiggle the HANDLE!

It's silly for us as humans to project shapes we recognize onto the random, ever-changing patterns of the cosmos. That said, this nebula totally came together to resemble a T-Rex, right? (Not to be confused with T. Rex Nebula, star of children's sci-fi cartoons.)

The comet is the prima donna of space. Look at it, trailing its beauty across the sky, taking up 75 percent of this entire painting. In fact, the artist was trying to capture a blank, night sky, and the comet totally photobombed that scene. What a diva!
This stump will house the magic beans that have been collected from the PlantSims you've met. Place six unique magic beans into the stump nodules, add a little water, and see what happens!
Getting too many penpals? The Bunchapals Postcard Corkboard will help you manage that growing stack of thoughtful, scenic mementos. Now with free thumbtacks!
Having a lovely holiday in Littlehaven. Wish you were here!
What Happens in Lucky Palms, Stays in Lucky Palms!
Gone Fishin' in Riverview! Havin' a Reel Good Time!
Ahoy! There be a fine breeze ‘n plenty ‘o plunder here in Barnacle Bay!
Bonjour! Enjoying fine juice and frog legs in Champs Les Sims!
Huzzah! Come tarry a while in Dragon Valley. Here be Dragons!
Moonlight Falls, home of all things Magical & Supernatural!
Horsing around with furry friends! Come Visit Appaloosa Plains!
Touring the bright lights of Bridgeport!
Fun in the Sun & Under the Sea! Relaxing at tropical Isla Paradiso!
Come experience Lunar Lakes! A place like nowhere else!
Eerie Greetings from Midnight Hollow, a Uniquely Eccentric Town.
Admiring the skies of Sunset Valley, where it all began!
Thinking of you from Twinbrook, where style is invented!
This larger than average space rock is prized for its stoic beauty in the face of calamity.
The uncommon space rock. Often quiet, always misunderstood.
This adorable little space rock often thrives best luxuriating in the light of a distant star. Or desk lamp.
This is an unnaturally large space rock. It is large enough to be an island. It can feel no pain. And it will never cry.
Ok, I'm shouting, I'm shouting! I'm a Magic Bean, and I'm shouting!
Never has the purity of Playfulness been so compact, as found here... within this Magic Bean!
How you doin' Flirty Magic Bean?
I'm a Magic Bean. I know I'm a Magic Bean. I'm that confident.

Sugar Skull - 2 of 9

Descriptions claimed it was the size of a hog, with the skin of a rat, and spines along its back from head to tail.

Tenth and final Sugar Skull.

A lone survivor stumbled back into town. She was the first member of the team that had disappeared; desert madness had overtaken her. She could only repeatedly mutter one name… El Chupacabra!

Sugar Skull - 6 of 9

At dawn, two members agreed to remain behind in the hopes their lost teammate would return. They were never heard from again.

Sugar Skull - 5 of 9

During the eighth night, the group awoke to screams in the distance. Someone had disappeared from their tent.

Sugar Skull - 9 of 9

The other half explored a nearby canyon. Some say the river there simply swept them away. Others say they were taken.

Sugar Skull - 7 of 9

With hope dwindling, the remaining members of the group split up upon discovering diverging tracks in the sand.

Sugar Skull - 1 of 9

Oasis Springs residents were reporting sightings of a mysterious creature.

Sugar Skull - 3 of 9

As complaints mounted, ten intrepid adventurers set across the desert in search of the beast.

Sugar Skull - 4 of 9

Members of the group reported a sense of unease at night, with the distinct impression that they were being watched.

Sugar Skull - 8 of 9

Half the team descended into a long abandoned mine tunnel. It would be their last glimpse of sunlight as they lowered themselves into the depths.

When each spot in this case contains a unique sugar skull, the ability to "Honor the Dead" will unlock. This interaction causes colorful smoke to spill forth, and your Sim will commune with their inner Catrina to allow for enhanced interactions with the Grim Reaper.\n\nSugar skulls are received as gifts from other Sims who are celebrating the Day of the Dead. They can only be acquired during the Day of the Dead Challenge.
A collapsed and overgrown tree trunk that makes an ideal hiding place for amphibians.
A dilapidated cistern with a dark, watery interior that is home to frogs.
Vaguely reminiscent of our own cetacean mammals, this "space whale" manipulates the fabric of time and space in navigating its environment.
A parasite that inhabits the brains of larger organisms and effectively plays puppetmaster. Ostensibly extremophilic.
Unlike its earthly counterparts, more than nintey percent of this coral-like structure is engaged in metabolic processes.
A gelatinous, docile organism that communicates via patterned pulses in its bioluminescent skin.
This "porcupine" exhibits shy, skittish behavior, expelling its "quills" to tranquilize would-be predators and making a hasty retreat thereafter.
The solid brown Dirt Frog is an unassuming fellow, but has a great sense of humor.
This frog is notorious for its ability to camouflage itself in more verdant environs.
The deep purple of this amphibian has contributed to its popularity among collectors and royal families the world over.
Thanks to its brilliant coloring, the Heart Frog has been given as a token of affection for years.
Long, sunny days sipping lemonade gives this frog its brilliant golden color.
The mud-colored speckling of this amphibian provides excellent camouflage in chocolate pudding.
The majestic Spotted Eggplant Frog flaunts plum-colored speckles and ironically dislikes veggies.
This frog’s name comes not from its rippling earth-tone skin, but from a love for sand-boarding.
This frog is proud of its green colors and skill hangin' ten.
The Surfer Eggplant Frog is well known in warm climates with gnarly beaches.
Love keeps this little red guy riding the waves.
The Sunsurfer Frog is not only yellow but also evokes the visual waves of heat rising on a hot day.
The Striped Dirt Frog, despite its homely looks, is actually considered to be the top of the Dirt Frog hierarchy.
Its skin is the height of camouflage as this frog feeds on the Striped Leaf Insect.
The Striped Eggplant Frog is prone to violent outbursts. No one's sure why.
Traditionally, this frog has been kept as a pet by barbers.
Unlike its namesake, the Tiger Frog does not have teeth. Or fur.
The Dirtwhirl Frog is often found spinning in circles in mud puddles.
Ancient tribespeople in the jungle are known for licking the HypnoFrog. Apparently it tastes like apples.
Egglant Whirl Frogs are known for being fickle and sarcastic.
Named for its slight resemblance to a bull's eye, this frog is known to have a natural fear of bows and arrows.
Also called the Daisy Frog, this specimen is well known for its bright voice and sunny disposition.
It's always fun to open a time capsule and catch glimpses of times past.
An old, worn roll of paper with cryptic markings smudged with dirt. It might be a good idea to keep this in your Sim's inventory before they start digging!
This powerful computer is so slim and light, you almost don’t know it’s there.
Break up with your hard drive. This lightning-fast all-in-one computer has all the processing power you need, in one wonderfully wireless Web-savvy machine. Surf’s up!

Who needs a fancy, thin computer? Really, it’s not like you’re going to carry it around with you. You’re just going to sit there, waiting for your files to load, especially that download from last week, which will finish up any day now.

This perfectly average desktop has all the abbreviations you need for basic computing: GB, GHz, RAM, SD, HD, SE, MP, and a bunch of numbers to go with them. That’s respectable, right?

Nothing exists in isolation, but only in relationship to everything. Is this a shelf? A cabinet? A counter? Can it not be a shelf-net-er? At Reclamation Homeware, we believe in unity and releasing the concept of “the other.” (Keep an eye out for our fall collection’s new fridge-ster-wave.)
Yessirree, that’s one fine piece of craftsmanship right there. 90-degree angles, flat surfaces, and everything. They just don’t make ‘em like this anymore!

Save money and hassle! Handle-free doors can help prevent food theft by dumb robbers and/or hungry teenagers. *Results may vary.

When you prepare meals on this shining, sanitary countertop, your family will know just how hard you work for them. Earn their love and respect.
A counter so elegant, so wildly upscale, it makes even a meal of humble hot dogs and canned soup taste almost inspired.

They may not do much about keeping the sun out, but these curtains are perfect for any room. With a variety of color and patterns for any child's room.
Adorn the walls with only the finest in colour and comfort--this gossamer sheath will be the center of conversation for years on end.
The cheque you’ll write is but a small price to pay for the lustre of privacy you’ll enjoy, without the prying eyes of neighbors.

In the mood for a soft touch? The Caress Curtains will add a soft touch of color to any room. The Slender model focuses on long, lovely lines that look dazzling by sun or starlight. A nice fit for those tight spots in your home.
Picture windows demand a wildly theatrical framing. These swags will make peeping neighbors think your every move is just terribly fascinating.

When you want to add a special touch, the Caress Curtains will fill your window in a most satisfying way. The Full model has just the right amount of material to provide a comfortable, well-rounded atmosphere to any room in the house.
Long, lean, and featuring the latest advances in verticality, these column curtains make everyone in the room look taller and thinner, guaranteed!
For those who don’t need fussy, ostentatious window treatments, these panels prove that you’ve got nothing to prove.
No fuss, no frills, no funny business. Just curtains. Nice, attractive curtains. Simplify your life.
Let the kids play hide-and-seek! Twist, turn, and pull away! Reinforced fixtures ensure that the games end in happy memories, not yelling and costly repairs.

When you want to give your house the ultimate caress, treat your room to these big, beautiful Caress Curtains. The Bountiful model explodes with soft, satiny folds, its ample layers filling a room with a beauty that can’t be ignored.
Hand-woven from thread spun by local grass-fed silkworms, this panel emits no greenhouse gases or harmful fumes!
You have the rest of your life to buy fancy curtains. For now, it’s okay to economize. As long as no one can see you in your underpants, you’re good!
They don’t block sun or ensure privacy. In fact, you’ll barely notice they’re there!
One moment they’re there, the next they’re gone… or are they? These shades are so ultra-slender, they’re practically almost virtually semi-nonexistent! But very attractive, too.
Some say that curtains are made for keeping away Peeping Toms, but we think these beauties invite adoration! Don’t hide your home—show it off!
Who are those people? What treasures lie within? Such are the questions people will ask when they see your windows swathed in this cortina obscura.
Cut from the wedding gown of Queen Gwendolen the Profligate, circa 1673. This swag sets a new standard in haphazard extravagance.
What every boring, dull room needs is a set of ziggy, zaggy valances to make things more interesting. Contrasting colors really shake it up.
Just so terribly dramatic. Place them above your fainting couch for those moments when you’re positively overcome with emotion.
Effect a carefully disheveled look with these hanging window treatments that say, “Frankly my dear, draperies are not my highest priority.”
Short, boring windows? Too many right angles? Take décor to new heights of interest with these unexpected tapestries that just can’t make up their minds.
With windows framed in festive silk, every day of your life feels like a merry puppet show! Just don’t think about who’s pulling the strings.
Can’t decide how to adorn your windows? These stately Victorian masterpieces encompass every type and piece of window treatment imaginable! More is more!
These fine velvet hangings are the height of civility and decorum. Just the right amount of style, just the right amount of coverage.
From a rail of fine bronze hangs a silken tapestry perfect for shutting out the world, when you really need some quality alone time.
Go old-school and get a little rococo with these wide swags of rich velvet. Enough to make a Victorian blush.
These striking blinds are made from an environmentally-friendly relative of the bamboo plant that manages to be far more obscure.
Perfectly identical slats impart an air of upper-class optimism. You make enough money to afford nice things from catalogs—decorate like it!
Why clutter your mind and your life with color, texture, or pattern? Sometimes good design is in the lack of details.
From our Cabin Collection, these rustic-chic blinds lend any room an air of outdoorsiness.

For all your right arrow needs. The Only One Directional Arrow will point you in the right direction! [Wink]
This directional arrow can be placed at any height. They do make a nice pattern when you place more than one. Make a statement with the Directional Up Arrow.
This universal symbol for women can be yours. With her sleek modern design, she will be the perfect addition! She's quiet and is a great listener!
This abstract rendition of man comes in a variety of colors. He's ageless, never to get old or die. He will always be there for you and never judge you.

This decal was granted for the New Lunar Year of the Pig, starting in February 2019. The Moon is known to be a trickster, always changing its visage, but sometimes it has its moments. Taking a short break from the New Lunar Year celebration, the Pig looked out one of the grand hall windows and spied the moon sinking toward the tree-line horizon. Usually, the moon spirit beamed one of its visages down to her, but that night, it gave way to her face. That night, she stared up to see her own likeness, and knew everything was going to be okay.
"Balloons drift upward into the clouds like dreams during the night." \nIt's so…Poetic.
Real pets are a hassle… kids hate that. No more fights about early-morning walks or puddles on the carpet! You'll never need to clean this decal's cage!
Are the adorable bunnies frolicking in the heather with glee, or are they frantically trying to outrun a predator? It’s exciting to wonder.
Children will gaze up and ponder the enormity of the heavens—the universe, celestial bodies, all that lies within the glorious firmament of Creation.
Kids can go to their happy place with these peaceful cumulus clouds. Or are they stormy nimbus clouds? Encourage the kids to look it up.
Anytime your child needs to be cheered up, they can imagine this T-Rex trying to juggle handfuls of pudding with its teeny, tiny arms. Hilarious.
A rhinoceros wizard? A turtle in a dunce cap? A dinosaur with an underbite? Your kids will have fun trying to figure this one out!

With every piece of furniture art designed by Reclamation Homeware, our goal is to remind people of all nations exactly what the human mind is capable of. The Centurion is no exception. It is impossible to gaze upon it and not shed a tear in awe of humanity's achievements.

Cups and saucers and chargers, oh my! This fully stocked dining hutch designed by Princess Cordelia is inspired by the very sea itself! The legs are modeled after the shape of an octopus tentacle and the top of the hutch is adorned with a seashell motif.

Washing your dishes by hand is a thing of the past! With The Professional Dish Laborer you don't need to dread an after party dish cleanup or your everyday dish duties. It combines performance and innovation with an attractive design. It's the closest we have seen to dishwasher perfection.

This classic dollhouse will transport your dolls back to the Victorian Age, a wonderful time when women wore corsets, men wore bowlers, and children were industrious and hardworking. Some of these values are still held today on the Kindermade Factory Fun Floor!

When it comes to quality, this set of double doors is absolutely the best. Our door-carving robots take their time and use materials that are second-to-none. It’s the fanciest set of doors we make, and it shows in the price! Spend now, enjoy top-quality doors forever!

Our assembly line of door-carving robots actually designed the Grand model of our Mega Double Doors on their own. They said that the combination of double doors with a half-circle would create a “design balance” that would lead to a “unity of spirit.” We’re honestly not sure what they meant by that or even why they’re thinking of such things!

When it comes to quality, this set of double doors is absolutely the most average. Our door-carving robots spend a decent amount of time using materials that are clearly good enough for the job. It’s not the fanciest set of doors we make, and it shows in the price! Save now, enjoy decent-quality doors forever!

East Shore Chateau sat abandoned for years. A brisk jaunt from the beach and surrounded by thick vegetation, its interior smelled of jungle musk, decaying mahogany, and sea air. Various species of vibrantly plumed birds and neon specked frogs called its dilapidated remains home. Few locals who remained on the island remembered the mystery surrounding its downfall—even fewer still spoke of it.\n\nIt was inevitable that when Mason Lupoe bought the mansion, it would cause quite a stir...
How tall can it go?\nCan it go real tall?\nAll the way up the wall?
Cha Cha Real Tall Sliding Door

The closest form of civilization to East Shore Chateau was a small coastal fishing village. The community watched from afar as Mason Lupoe first purchased the estate and soon after began repairs. The sounds of saws and hammers echoed through the dense surrounding jungle, washed out by the nearby waves breaking against the beach. Then one day... nothing.

No sim came or went from East Shore Chateau, and it remained disturbingly quiet as weeks stretched on. Mason Lupoe, himself, was declared missing. Investigators and anyone looking into the disappearances also seemed to vanish in the shadow cast by East Shore. It was at that point, the community made a decision. The estate was to be torn down from the outside in.

And so it was done. Plank by plank, window by window, the estate was dismantled—its fine furnishing and trim re-purposed around the island. The doors were sold in an auction. It is said... that on humid summer nights the doors can be heard sliding open and closed as the spirits of those missing pass through.
These friendly companions are there to comfort children when they look at their doors in the dark. Hopefully there will be no nightmares here.
Understated elegance, smooth finishes. Entice your guests by casually revealing your domain, keeping them guessing of what lies beyond.

Edgar, a lion of generous repute…
Always shared his labors fruit…
Never without…
An ounce of doubt…
Could any, of his generosity, refute.

A trickster troll by the name of Stoar…
Was oft fond of a playful trick or four…
Until one day…
Ended his play…
And his head ended upon this door.
Visually evoke Prairie-style architecture without breaking the bank; save money on the lack of door, too.
The keystone detailing is not integral to the arch; it just looks nice.
Arches have a higher load-bearing capacity than a simple post-and-lintel structure, allowing for a wider range of use and facilitating taller construction.
A narrow entryway for when you don't even require a door for a room divider.
The post and lintel design is a fundamental building block of architecture. This entryway frame is a fundamental building block, too.
A stylish entryway door with two arched windows.
A single wooden door in Prairie style.
In almost every color of the rainbow, chose the door that is right for you.\nWarning: Product may not be actually available in your preferred rainbow color, but does offer a one rainbow of colors.
An unassuming wooden door suitable for use anywhere you need an unobtrusive portal.
Your basic wooden door found at the entrance to bedrooms, offices and closets everywhere.
Four panels lend visual interest to this otherwise basic door.
Six panels make a statement in this basic interior door.
Five panels is an unusual design choice for an interior door, but not so unusual as to be utterly distracting.
The curved top panel and rectangular bottom panels of this wooden door evoke the Dutch doors of yesteryear.

Yes siree, nothing says “fine living” like a high-quality door. No mis-shuts or swing opens with a door like this one! You got your brass knob, your strong hinges, a nice rectangle shape. Boy howdy, that is some fine door right there!

When you come home from a day of measuring the seasonal rise of Vibrio bacteria in brackish waters, you need a door you can rely on. That’s why so many Marine biologists choose this door. You might be worried about ineffective efforts to save the Atlantic sturgeon, but you’ll never have to worry about coming home to an inferior door.

Sure, it might not have a fancy label, but our unbranded entry device is just as effective as all those name brand Doors. Built from many of the same materials, the unbranded entry device offers an opening and closing experience just as good as the major brands, and at just as good a price!

Hardwood window frames can cause your glass panes to scratch and crumble at the edges. They can even stress your windows to the point of shattering! The Perfect Pane door has firm yet pliable frames that keep glass pristine. That’s because they’re made entirely from the bones of Atlantic Sturgeon!

We’ll be honest. We set out to make a simple window, split into three equal panes. Then we just kept adding and adding features and now everyone thinks it’s a door. Our fault really - we can see now how the whole project is a little overdesigned. Use it however you’d like.

POW!!! Kablammo Superdoor! You’ve NEVER seen a door like this one! Featuring Rite-Grip knob technology and triple-swing hinges for extra opening/closing power! You haven’t doored a day in your pathetic life until you’ve stepped through a KABLAMMO!!!
Fiberglass doors are durable and resistant to water damage, making them a good choice for bathrooms, saunas and laundry facilities.
Only female Sims are allowed beyond this door. Any problem with that?
Only male Sims are allowed beyond this door.

The phrase “exceptional quality in mission-style door-making” gets thrown around a lot these days. We at the MegaMission Outdoor Warehouse like to think that we’ve truly earned that praise with the deluxe model of our Mega Door.

One of our top designers challenged us to make a door “without all the bells and whistles.” We found out later that he was crazy and meant it literally, but we still went ahead with our plans for the Budget DeLite model of our Mega Door. The minimally acceptable amount of door for not a lot of Simoleons!
A front door that combines the warmth of wood and the impersonal coldness of frosted glass.

Bring a piece of happiness to your child's bedroom today with this whimsical low dresser. Kid tested, child approved.

Your dresser holds clothing which can be rearranged into an amazing array of styles and outfits. Like the human heart, the dresser is the container of all of the different permutations of YOU. It deserves the consideration and attention you’d put into choosing your own casket. Might we at Reclamation Homeware humbly suggest… The Neo?
Cutting-edge polymers protect your clothes from moths, eavesdropping by government intelligence, and ever going out of fashion.

With the Enigma dresser, as with so many things, it’s what’s beneath the surface that counts. Hiding below its unassuming top is a treasure trove of hidden curves and secrets. Intricate designs and fine details dare you to explore its depths fully.

Nothing says romance like a few bumps, bruises and mysterious scars. And nothing shelters your clothes with such stoic elegance as the Weathered Wonder. Standing tall, with long graceful lines and four proud, battered drawers, this triumphant antique is the stuff of true fantasy.
Subtly evoking Inquisition-era furnishings, Reclamation Homeware's six-drawer dresser is girdled in cold steel, like a horizontal Iron Maiden or a mad scientist's apothecary chest.
Child-sized four-drawer dresser doubles as a bench, desk, or changing table. Sturdy enough to withstand repeated "monkey on the bed" games.

True Mission-style design isn't just about hardwood grain, metal pulls, and geometric lines. It's also about dovetails, cornices, mortise, and tenons. If you know what any of this means, then you want this dresser.

Princess Cordelia enjoyed structured clothing. Often sporting a bustle and a corset, undergarments were everything to her! She needed a lot of space to store her unmentionables so she designed this bottomless dresser that allowed her to change outfits at will. Amazing!
Your clothing will keep a low profile in this preternaturally understated six-drawer dresser.
This cubby allows for a little flair by pairing boxes with icons for easy toddler use. Some cubbies even have their own splash of color to make this an instant win for any child.
This dresser is flawless. I heard that Diego Lobo has a dresser like this, and he filled it with clothes, so I got a dresser like this, and I filled it with clothes.
Is that your bedroom or a country inn? Only your dresser knows for sure. A heirloom-quality piece in rich finishes.
Tall and handsome, this armoire knows better than to mar its Nordic beauty with even a smidgen of extraneous trim.
Serve all the spicy goodness of Buffalo wings, without worrying about the mess! Wonderful shaken, stirred, or with lemon.
Instantly changes Sim's body to maximum largeness
Instantly changes Sim's body to maximum lean

Devoid of all fluid. Think of the mixological possibilities.

The late great novelist, Wouldiwas Shookspeared, once commented, "The past and present are merely parts of speech." Just like this Family Portrait is a collection of your past and present, hanging on your wall. Or... in your memories if you are just storing this under an old comforter in the attic.

A smoke detector that has all the features you need--an overzealous sensor and a screechingly loud alarm. Buy one for every room!
A pile of embers is all that remains after fire has run its course.
Guaranteed safe until the seal is removed. Because when safety matters, Safety Seal!\nSafety Note: Seal automatically removed prior to use, for your safety.
Manoir believes a fireplace should anchor the room it occupies, with precious treasures arranged on the mantel and only the most tasteful furniture arranged nearby.
In the days when the hearth was the primary heat source and there was no television to stare at, fireplaces served more than one purpose. Relive those days with this gorgeous stone and metal piece.
This low-profile fireplace will be the focal point of your living room with its sleek lines and designer colors.
Safety first! Use this control box to manage your building's sprinkler system in case of fire or other industrial accident.\n\nNote: Sprinklers require a ceiling to deploy.

The Boneyard is not for the faint of fin. Swim your Rainbow Trout up another stream. Don’t sting your Clownfish in here. And take that Sunfish to warmer waters. Don’t mess with the Boneyard, or you’ll find yourself boneless.

Gelatinous Treats Ltd., was provided a thousand fresh water Gummie Guppys, and asked to create a special home for these newly discovered fish. They made several requests for additional fish samples… until finally delivering this finished product. While many agree that it is a masterful creation, they can’t help but question the name.
Classic round glass fishbowl allows your piscine friends a 360-degree view of their surroundings.
Throw this pole over your shoulder and tell everyone you've gone fishing.
Forget the fish sticks--little kids love the chance to catch their own dinner. You'll still have to clean it and cook it for them, though.
Stake out your prime fishing holes with this simple wooden sign.

Four-tiered fountain provides an ebullient cascade of water to enliven any garden.
This unobtrusive round fountain features sheets of softly falling water that provide an all-natural white noise sound barrier.
Inspired by the thermal springs of Geyser Park, this fountain continuously spurts unpredictable bursts of water into the air.

We looked at refrigerators, and we realized we could do something better. What if using a fridge was as simple as opening a door, and touching the food you wished to select? Our fridge can do that, and what’s more, it’s available starting today. Introducing: The Schmapple Fridge. It’s Refrigeration, to the Power of You.
This fridge combines the charm of an antique icebox with the convenience of modern technology, ensuring your food stays cold without a daily ice delivery.

You will literally bladder fail when you see how awesome the crisper is in this fridge. This crisper is so good it’s ridiculous. You'll perceive levels of crispness you didn't even know existed. This crisper is so freaking amazing, we actually considered making the entire fridge the crisper. It’s that good.

We’re going to be upfront with you here: this fridge does not have a crisper. Oh, it has a drawer in the bottom with the word “crisper” written on it, but honestly? It’s just a drawer. But now that you know you can trust us, why not pick up a Budget Dee-Lux for most of your food-storing needs?

To answer your question: Yes. The crisper in this refrigerator is excellent. Rest assured that everything of yours that needs crisping will be sufficiently crisped, even if your standards for crispness are very high. (And whose aren’t?) Additional features: Shelves, Tiny light bulb.

This is a pretty good fridge. You should be fully satisfied with it. If we HAD to nitpick… maybe the crisper could be a little better. But seriously, it’s a solid refrigerator, we feel like jerks for even bringing the crisper up. It’s a solid fridge.
A frighteningly modern stainless steel refrigerator that brooks no compromise.
Icebox of Steel by Krampft Industries

The latest in hand-held electronic Easel technology allows you to take your creativity anywhere, printing hi-rez imagery without the having to stand for messy canvas creation on rickety wooden antiquities.

Instead of getting your toddlers hooked on the TV, you can give them a tablet for all of their needs...Well most of them...okay it keeps them distracted for when you need a few seconds to yourself. No promises on how long that will last.
A portable electronic device suitable for all kinds of entertainment, the Slablet is also reminiscent of the days when communication required a piece of stone and a chisel.

A gate only NEEDS one door, but you know who stops at one door? Peasants. That’s the number of doors peasants use. You can do better, and that’s why it’s worth investing in the double deluxe model of the Mega Gate. It’s like having a gate, only yours is better!
The perfect defense against peeping toms, solicitors and strays.
Tiled columns and fanciful wrought iron keep intruders beautifully at bay.
Hefty yet dignified wooden gate offers the utmost security and privacy.
These dignified modern security gates send a clear and pointed message.
Offers a glimpse of your contemporary home without welcoming everyone and their mother.
Featuring regal marble columns and a royally heavy door.
A simple, graceful entry for your home sweet home.
Just imposing enough to make the neighbors wonder.
Created for households where lefties have the upper hand, this modern gate leaves righties reaching.

You’ll pay a little more for the deluxe model of our Mega Gate, but the second you open one you’ll see why: Hinge-Rite technology. Every swing of the gate is the promise of smooth, soundless action from the finest hinges outside of the space program. You will weep when you see these hinges.

At MegaMission Outdoor Warehouse, we know that the worst part of the fence is that there’s no way through it! It’s a perfectly impenetrable border! That’s why we developed the greatest breakthrough ever in fence technology: the Gate! Now you can go inside OR outside the fence, again and again!
Perfect for discreet encounters, it comes with a lantern to signal late-night visitors.

Can’t you just picture the old artisan hunched over his workbench, his strong but knobby hands reaching out for just the right tool to coax his artistic vision forward from the oak? We can’t because these gates were made on an assembly line by robots, but they look EXACTLY like the handmade antique kind.
Grease the hinges for privacy, or leave them squealing to tattle on sneaking teens (or grownups who think like them).

This lantern was granted for the New Lunar Year of the Pig, starting in February 2019.\n\nMy mother's favorite saying was, "You can't wrap fire with paper," but then I brought one of these home from the New Lunar Year Festival. Now her favorite saying is, "My kid is a smart aleck."
Paper Lantern of the Wiseacre Moon
For days of sunshine or falling rain, the One Cloudy Day lamp has you covered for all of your lamp cloud needs. With a range of colors from Sunny Yellow to Gloomy Gray.

When they said we couldn’t make a functional and breathtaking light fixture from reclaimed garbage, we laughed. We laughed right in their stupid faces. The word “can’t” is not recognized at Reclamation Homeware, and anyone who says it is fired. And the light we “couldn’t” make? We did.

When something old is transformed into something wonderful and new, it’s like hearing the laughter of all the children in the world. What used to be trash has been collected, pressed, painted, and reintroduced to you as The Serendipity premium light set from Reclamation Homeware. Available for purchase now. Do it for the children.
When omniscient cuttlefish attack, take heart! This hanging light will save the galaxy with its sleek lines and high-tech components.
A hanging light--perfect for your anti-gravitational beverage of choice!
Our absurdly specific number of quality checks ensures that the excellence of our light fixtures is never compromised. This pendant-style ceiling lantern is no exception.
Torcher Inc. Fiat Luxe Pendant Lantern

Illuminate any dinner gathering with the warm, soft glow of this homey chandelier. Bask in its golden light, appreciate its brassy curves and remark at how cleverly it evokes a piece of your grandmother’s china.

Surround yourself with gentle, soothing light. This lovely chandelier features five glimmering lights that cast a glow so warm and soft, it feels as if you are bathing in candlelight. The round porcelain base and decorative brass ring invite you to grab hold and swing, but you’ll be too relaxed to try it.
Lights, camera, action! Theater-style lighting for all the drama llamas on the scene; individualized positioning guarantees a spotlight for everyone.

Bent wood and bolted iron lend an ominously rustic air to this ceiling fixture.
Worried about the “tone” in your kids’ room? Lighten up with this charming ceiling light!
Chase away the shadows with this elegant lantern chandelier replete with hardwood detailing.

Whenever Princess Cordelia's Submarine dove or rose, she enjoyed watching the chandeliers tilt. This particular chandelier was named after Princess Cordelia's first pirate boyfriend, Captain Long John Buttercups. He always said this chandelier reminded him of his old galleon.
Set the solar system soaring on your ceiling, brightened by the Sun itself. Pluto not included.

Unlocked at level 2 of the Astronaut career.
Cool, sleek pendant lamp will light up your life in an unobtrustive yet slightly institutional fashion.
These anchored balloons won't float away like a normal balloon. No need to tie them to your child's wrist… they're already tied to the ground.
These candles are perfect for placement on your favorite rangoli designs.

Is it a lamp? A shelf? A work of art? So many questions! Here’s a question for you: why does it have to “be” anything? Defy your compulsion to define everything you see and just let The Arcadia BE whatever it will be. The Arcadia: the new lamp from Reclamation Homeware.
As a thank-you for joining us for our third trip around the sun as well as embarking on this new adventure, let this lamp light up your Sims' world.

There’s a certain comfort gifted to us by reliable furniture, such as our stoic Cornerstone lamp. Wherever you need light it will stand, tall and firm, shining forth its brilliant light. It will never tire and never yield for as long as we desire.

Is there anything more serene than lying on a grassy hill in the countryside under the warm rays of a mid-morning sun? Bring serenity home with the Sunbather lamp, which shines so brightly you’ll swear you can feel its warm light all over your skin.
Green is the color of growth, of spring, of safety. Green lighting helps restore depleted energy and subtly implies permission for all sorts of esoteric activities in your home.
This pillar fixture sports a trio of multicolored lampshades ready to get the party started.
Reclamation Homeware presents a floor lamp that's proud to be an overgrown desk lamp.
Worried about the “tone” in your kids’ room? Lighten up with this adorable floor light!

Our floor lamp incorporates everything that makes mission design great. It’s a celebration of straight lines and clean angles, the kind of perfect simplicity that can only be achieved by a warehouse of furniture crafting precision robots. Each mica shade is lovingly assembled by micabots, or would be if robots could feel love.
The severe lines of this floor lamp provoke a stylish anxiety balanced by the soothing effect of its cool blue lampshade.

Whenever Princess Cordelia's Submarine dove or rose, she enjoyed watching the lights briefly flicker. This particular lamp was named after Princess Cordelia's first pirate boyfriend, Captain Long John Buttercups. He always said this lamp reminded him of his old galleon.

Dating pirates did have perks for Princess Cordelia. Birthday presents were usually flashy and made of gold. Such was the case for this candelabra, made of two thousand ounces of gold. Now released for mass market, it’s made of brass.
Two Thousand Ounces of Gold Under the Sea
When life gives you lemons, turn on this lamp. You'll be lounging in a hammock in no time.
