Unlocked at level 10 of the Painter career while in the Master of the Real branch.
Sleek contemporary lines mean you'll never use this lampshade as a party hat.
A minimalist pillar lamp for all your unobtrusive lighting needs.
This Victorian-style swan-neck hanging outdoor lamp from the Salem Collection keeps ruffians and rogues at bay. Raccoons, too.
This inexpensive outdoor post lamp doubles as a bug-zapper.
You probably won't fear an invasion from outer space with these outdoor lights, but you may wonder if subterranean aliens are coming to visit. At least they'll be able to see where they're going!

All our lives, we are trained to stifle our true nature. To punch a time clock. To mortgage away our vitality. At Reclamation Homeware, we defy false desires. We live in a world lit only by the light of the soul’s true purpose—and by these super hip pathway lamps.

MegaMission Warehouse lighting fixtures have to be both beautiful and functional. That’s why every single lamp we sell is carefully hand-crafted by our precision robots. Well, we say “hand…” They really have more of a spatula/clamp combination.

The real beauty of antiques is the unique quirks and imperfections they possess. Every antique garden lamp we produce is specially weathered on our assembly lines for a look that is truly one in a million. Sorry… of. One OF a million.

Like a constellation, our lives take shape as lines traced between experiences. We live. We move forward. We love. We move forward. We trip over a garden hose and fall to the ground, weeping. We turn on a light—and move forward. The Animus outdoor path lamp, by Reclamation Homeware.
Add a touch of floral color to your lighting design with this Queen Anne-style lamppost adorned with two hanging baskets suitable for planting.
Georgina Outdoor Lamppost With Double Hanging Planter
Trompe l'oeil LED lighting mimics a flower in shape, but shines like the moon after dark. Perfect for late-blooming garden parties.
A sturdy outdoor wall fixture that seethes with industrial chic.
Elegant colonial style informs this delicate outdoor wall lamp. The founding fathers would be proud.
Budget-friendly outdoor lighting for when you want all illumination, no ambiance.

Furniture is art. And no one knows art better than the programmers who invented the AI algorithms for our furniture-crafting robots. That’s why every MegaMission Wall Lantern that rolls off the line looks just as artistic as the thousands before and after it.

When you see the fine craftsmanship of our deluxe Mega Wall Lantern, you’ll want to shake hands with the talented robots who put it together. We can’t let you, though, because they would pulverize every bone in your hand.
Sooner or later, everyone needs an understated tube of light. Clean lines and modern styling give this outdoor sconce an air of quiet ennui.

On a cold winter’s day, Princess Cordelia would ask her pilot to bring the submarine up to the surface. She loved watching water droplets freezing so beautifully as they dripped from the Eppsilon’s hull. To commemorate and recapture that moment, she designed this wall sconce.
Looks like UFO, shines like a beacon. Galvanized aluminum plus a LED light source make for an affordable outdoor lighting option.
If you're nostalgic for the glow of gaslight but hate the explosions, this Victorian-style electric outdoor sconce is for you.
Life is always a party with an instant-on laser light show that’s glowing with surprises. Light up the night with special animations featuring the Freezer Bunny or Grim Reaper. It’s Laserrific!
Let There Be Light! Laser Show
Brighten baby’s day with this adorable panda table lamp! The culturally savvy parasol raises baby’s world awareness, brightening up your baby, too.

Can a piece of furniture make you cry? We don’t mean if you hit your knee on it, we mean through its startling beauty and truth. When we first saw The Resplendent we cried for days, loudly and with no consideration for anyone around us. That’s what REAL lamps do. From Reclamation Homeware.
Celebrate Kwanzaa with this festive candle holder. Don't forget to light a new candle each day!
Light a candle each day of Hanukkah with this festive menorah!
Modeled after the boomerang that incapacitated a president! Some journalist's harmless joke, or a global conspiracy? You decide!
Innocent jellyfish or malicious alien lifeform? You decide, with this great conversation-starter!
In honor of your worldly travels, your Sims can bask in the glow of this ambient lamp, available only in the most culturally sensitive of colors.
You've got Ambitions, so you should be proud. But you'll be even prouder of this shimmering lamp, which would outshine someone less, well, ambitious.

Congratulations! The UV Light Award was designed especially for Sims who love the night life, and so maybe miss seeing this thing called the sun. Casting gentle beams of UV light, this aptly named award ensures your Sims get enough Vitamin D, without daytime waking.
This lamp of recognition is fitted with a self-charging battery and NeverDie internal bulb, so your name can be illuminated for many Generations to come.
Let your love for Mother Nature’s creatures shine for all the world to see! As a proud Pets owner, you deserve nothing less.
All the world’s a stage—and now your Sims have their very own spotlight! Cherish this brightly burning lamp, and take a bow in its beam. Bravo!
Your Name in Lights Showtime Award
Believe in the power of magic, and the gentle glow of this mysterious lamp will cast a spell over all who venture near. Well, not really. But it’s designed to look like it would.
This rain-repellant, wind-resistant, UV-protected lamp can withstand temperatures as high as 200°F and as low as -30°F, so your Sims can enjoy it in any season. Hooray!
You created so many college memories. This luminescent Alma Mater Award is a special reminder of all your Sims learned, failed to learn or already forgot from University. May it shine forever!
Brighter than a tiki torch, and clearer than crystal tropical waters, this incandescent award is a happy reminder of Paradise.
You've been to the future and back again—and all you have to show for it is this award-lamp-thingy. And the memories…ah yes, the memories.
Time Travelers Into the Future Award

Many lamp experts agree that comfort begins with lighting, specifically the lighting that comes from lamps. To give your home a perfectly pleasing aura, try turning on the Soothelight. One flick of your finger and you can feel all your inhibitions melt away.

Imagine yourself in the presence of royalty. Slowly the queen steps toward you, the flounces of her gown quivering as she offers a kiss to each of your cheeks. The Royal Embrace table lamp is evocative of such a moment. Curvaceous, be-ribboned and elegant, with regal fleur-de-lis, it casts a royally cold light that is nonetheless enviable.
Strike a pose and shine! This handy desk lamp can be re-positioned however you like, so you can shine a light on your best work and leave the rest in shadow.

Pounded into a rugged circle, this lamp’s hammered steel frame retains the marks of every blow and the bulge of every bolt, staying true to the hands that built it. The three stark bulbs cast an unrelenting circle of light, illuminating the world with raw authenticity.
In the Raw Industrial Table Lamp
Worried about the “tone” in your kids’ room? Lighten up with this lovely table light!
Is better lighting a GOAL in your kids’ room? Give it a real KICK with this sporty table light! (It’s a soccer ball.)

Imagine, if robots could actually think, what bright ideas they’d have! This playful little bot is a glowing addition to any tot’s desk or nightstand. Simply flip the switch for a brilliant idea that lights up the room.

Chandlers have long sought the elusive fourth candle display. Three is a magic number, its placement always perfect, but four… the placement never feels right, the function never flows properly, the je ne sais quoi was always off. But now, beauty has frozen in time, form and function have come together as one! “Four Festive Candles, ho, ho, ho,” is testament to that journey, that perfection CAN be found, even in the elusive “four.”
Four Festive Candles, ho, ho, ho!

Three candles who stand still, save their flickering lights, sought refuge from the impending night. Said one to three, the tallest was he, excuse me please, but I don’t see why we should fear the night, we shine, we glow, we light up so bright. Said three to one, the smallest of thee, it is true we shine so bright, but my wicks height is low, and soon, out of sight.

Thanks to the mass-produced antiques from MegaMission Furniture Warehouse, you can own a handsome, mission-style table lamp that’s exactly as unique as everyone else’s! Each scuff mark and rough edge was carefully placed according to our proprietary imperfection algorithm for maximum quaintness. How charming!

Light bulbs are good for a lot of things, but they haven’t come close to replicating the rich, golden ambiance of a true antique oil lamp, until now. Handcrafted in the artisan tradition, this electric-powered lamp casts the same flickering lamplight, warmth and even smell of yesteryear’s kerosene companions. Battery compartment is concealed in the base for a cord-free effect.

The remarkable quality of this lamp’s craftsmanship shines through every slatted angle and casts your incredible taste onto every wall of the room. Illuminate your brilliance, only with the Angling for Light.

While her submarine was docked, Princess Cordelia enjoyed some fresh air on the deck. Looking down she saw the glow of millions of jelly fish. It was breathtaking. Inspired by that moment, she designed this lamp and brought the shape and glow of the jellyfish bell to you. Aren't you glad she didn't include tentacles?

Princess Cordelia tried scallops for the first time while aboard her submarine. Cooked in garlic, they were the most delicious thing she had ever eaten. She was thankful for the experience and in honor of the poor scallop that lost its life, she designed this lamp. So touching!

Sea stars occasionally stuck themselves to the portholes of the submersible, rather annoyingly blocking the light, not to mention the view. Determined not to let her irritation get the better of her, Princess Cordelia created a lamp that is a glorious tribute to the sea star-with squat, pointy legs that can actually regenerate when harmed.

Whenever Princess Cordelia's Submarine dove or rose, she enjoyed watching the lights briefly flicker. This particular lamp was named after Princess Cordelia's first pirate boyfriend, Captain Long John Buttercups. He always said this lamp reminded him of his old galleon.
This virtually indestructible lamp casts its unflinching glare wherever you direct it. Let it shine down from a discreet distance, or intensify the effect by lowering it close to your target.
Unlock by reaching level 5 of the Secret Agent career.
Unlocked at level 5 of the Secret Agent career.
Did you know that a 12-sided polygon is called a dodecagon? Enlighten yourself with this modern lamp. Sweetly simple, its minimal design is a lovely complement to any contemporary living space.
This oil lamp is a perfect accent piece for any Diwali celebration.

The mystical and alluring Coolala has transformed into a wall light to protect your child's dreams. Don't let its cute appearance fool you. Coolala, The Defender, is a force to be reckoned with against all kinds of monsters with its blinding light... especially the ones under the bed.

In our ongoing quest to shine the light of human progress into darkness wherever it may lie, The Quetzal is our radiant silver sword. A literal bringer of light, it serves as a beacon, a promise of the brilliance man can achieve. From Reclamation Homeware.

We understand the instinct to turn away from The Chimera. Furniture design this fearless can be startling, but we urge you not to back down. Stare directly into the light of this indomitable fixture and understand: you can be fearless, too. Own The Chimera. Tame The Chimera. Reclamation Homeware.

There’s a reason the light bulb is the symbol of inspiration. Who hasn’t felt that “aha” moment when presented with an exquisitely designed and yet practical lighting feature? The Aeon was specifically designed for you to stand beneath in quiet contemplation. Find your Aha.

At Reclamation Homeware, we banish the word “price,” in favor of “value.” We defy “products” and present you with “tools.” We terminate our “employees” and hire our “friends.” We transform your “money” into “light” with the Ignite.
An abstract recreation of the famous prism experiment. Where spectronomy first began!
Luminescent stone from the depths of the earth! Ponder its mysterious origins and geochemical makeup while brushing your teeth!

Like a sweet spoonful of whipped cream, sometimes the richest comforts come from just a touch of joy. The Dollop o' Light will fill your home with perfect little spoonfuls of light. And just to keep you grounded, each warm glow is supported by a naughty little curl of cold iron.

This dramatic wall sconce is so reminiscent of a golden conch, guests may crowd around to hear the sea. Don’t let them try it. The brass mounting gets incredibly hot, so all they’ll hear is their own yelp of pain.

Why clutter up your room with standing lamps when you could have a Cup O’ Light radiating from every wall? Each faux-alabaster sconce casts a glow so delectable, you’ll drink up the effect… and crave more.

Light up your walls and protect them, too, with this indestructible resin wall sconce banded with titanium. Deep U-shape provides maximum wall coverage while diffusing the light to discourage attackers.
Whether you’re putting on makeup or shaving away nighttime stubble, it’s essential to see yourself in the best possible light. This three-light fixture not only illuminates every flaw, but erases it.
Me, Oh, Me, Oh, Me Vanity Lighting
Why buy fine art if no one can see it? Shine a light on your own fabulous taste with this wall-mounted art lamp. Got bad art? Splurge on a light anyway, and everyone will think it’s amazing.
Unlock by reaching level 2 of the Painter career.
Unlocked at level 2 of the Painter career.
The AquaGlow lends vibrant underwater illumination to your pool for safe swimming at night.

If your space is devoid of natural light, get the next best thing: the Bunker Be Bright. Not even pretending to be attractive, these steel-caged monstrosities cast a cold fluorescent glow that doubles as a repellant against zombies and vampires.
Frigid steel, icy glass, and the cold, cold glow of LED lighting casts clarity on all who pass beneath. Unfinished styling complements our full industrial collection, for the ultimate in urban chic.
This blindingly bright light doubles as a white noise machine since its low hum is actually somewhat soothing.
Disguised as modern lighting design, this beautiful light doubles as a secret weapon. Of course, you may need some practice channeling its power. It’s a slippery slope to darkness.

You never can tell when someone will steal your light. Constructed of rugged, unyielding metal, this theft-proof iron cage puts your lighting literally behind bars-a blunt reminder of what will happen should anyone think of taking it.
Worried about the “tone” in your kids’ room? Lighten up with this awesome wall light!

Birthed from recycled didgeridoo parts, the Harmonic tube light fuses the glow of tomorrow’s purpose with the essential vibrations of what has come to pass. Witness that middle space. Be an instrument. Find the bathroom in the middle of the night. The Harmonic, by Reclamation Homeware.

The true artisan craftsmanship of this wall sconce is made ever more apparent by the faux-candle fixture behind its angled frame. At once elegant and rustic, its gentle flickering light creates just the right ambiance for Mission-style homes of unparalleled taste.

Never has a simple box contained so much beauty. With slender slats running up, down and straight across its glowing white interior, this Mission-style wall sconce adds a touch of classic elegance to your dining or living space.
Beauty in a Box Mission Lighting

If you can't live under the sea like Princess Cordelia, bring the ocean life to you! The Tunicate Wall Sconce is modeled after one of the most beautiful types of sea sponges. It was Princess Cordelia's favorite sconce. She often parked her submarine outside a reef and just soaked in the sea life, metaphorically.

Princess Cordelia was known to lounge by a tide pool for hours, just watching the fragile beauty entrapped within. One of her favorite creatures was the anemone, its petal-like tentacles waving innocently as it waited to ensnare its lunch. With subtle curls and an organic, unassuming form, this elegant wall sconce was created in the anemone’s honor.

It can get dark under the sea, particularly when pirates keep toppling into your lamps. This cast iron wall sconce is nearly indestructible, especially when mounted above hat-level. It casts a light so intense that Princess Cordelia’s 2nd pirate boyfriend was known to use it for tanning, until she dumped him for being so vain.

The glass of this wall sconce was once clear and crisp. A special machine on the Lady Cordelia’s Submarine processes the glass and gives it this opaque, soft feel. The machine blasts the glass with sand, salt, and steam which weathers this sconce in the same way as natural sea glass.

When Princess Cordelia designed this lamp, she was feeling nostalgic for the land she left behind. While sitting in the workshop on her submersible, the Eppsilon, she thought of the dimly-lit gas lights that lined the streets and the silhouettes of women in long dresses and men in top hats walking by. Sigh.

Whenever Princess Cordelia's Submarine dove or rose, she enjoyed watching the lights briefly flicker. This particular lamp was named after Princess Cordelia's first pirate boyfriend, Captain Long John Buttercups. He always said this sconce reminded him of his old galleon.

Add a splash of light to any wall with this casual modern sconce. Cascading down from a brushed nickel box, the slightly flared linen shade evokes angled rays of light, but adds nothing more, being minimal and all.

In a good relationship, the spotlight is shared, so this intelligent light fixture provides not one, not three, not five lights, but two-the perfect number, the ultimate balance: a light for each loving party, held together by a cold metal box.
Embrace the beauty of a simple plank and let its gorgeous symmetry shine forth. Recommended for extremely narrow hallways, small rooms, and other places where space is at a premium.
A lid for your lip balm.
Lawn flamingos are constantly at odds with lawn gnomes.
A single square of pavement colored grey.
A single rectangle of pavement colored grey.
A slate pavement tile appropriate for creating paths.
An unusually shaped stone perfect for garden paths.
A pair of unusually shaped stones perfect for garden paths.
A flat rock perfect for garden paths.
A garden plot designed to fit nicely in corners.
A garden plot designed to fit nicely in corners.
A large grassy plot for your garden.
A grassy garden plot that is shaped like a triangle.
A plot of grass. How nice!
A lovely round plot of grass for your garden.
A lovely garden plot with green grass.
The first in a series of decorative garden plots.
The second in a series of decorative garden plots.
The third in a series of decorative garden plots.
The fourth in a series of decorative garden plots.
Mail boxes are essential as they are the primary way to receive bills.
Mail boxes are essential as they are the primary way to receive bills.

This quaint little device is called a mailbox. But unlike the mailboxes you might be used to, this one is a literal box with incredibly finite space. Bills and junk mail slowly accumulate inside its small, metal frame, but no one really knows how or why. A fun curiosity for collectors!
Conquer the comedy circuit behind the Queen’s special microphone. Let's play the crowd and get some laughs!

Ever feel like you were a specimen in a lab, with everyone staring and analyzing and dissecting and judging? Well, now you can study the effects of such behavior more comfortably, from the other side of the lens.

What if a microwave could give you less of what you don’t want, and more of what you don’t realize you need? Things like a larger viewing area, and three life-changing colors? Well you can have it right now. Introducing: The Schmapple Micro. It’s Microwaves, to the Power of You.

For the finest in microwave cooking, it has to be the Omniwaver. This incredible device bombards your food with a previously undiscovered form of radiation. We can’t promise that the omicron waves will cook your food faster, or hotter, than conventional microwaves, but man they really bring out the flavor somehow!

Built with salvaged materials from discarded 80’s electronic children’s toys and assembled by haphazardly-trained gerbils, the Wavescatter is the perfect microwave for the budget-conscious bachelor who loves his meals burnt on the outside and frozen in the center.

Our microwave will blast your leftovers with radiation so thoroughly and with such intensity that no living thing should approach it for decades. Other microwaves just raise your food’s temperature slightly, but when you want food that’s been permanently sterilized, there’s only one name in the business: FOOD ANNIHILATOR.

Function falls madly in love with Fashion in the OTP Split Mirror. Its upper-half perfectly reflects the fashion icon standing before it, while the lower half can be angled to properly inspect shoes and calves. Do we ship this mirror? Yaaaas.

Who knows what our reflections do in the shadow universe they inhabit behind the looking glass. All we know is they are always there for us when we stare into that magic pane. Give the other you an elegant view into our world with The Obverse from Reclamation Homeware.

Sometimes a little part of you is not enough. The full body version of our mirror wants all of you, from head to toe. Stand close to it and let it drink in your entire being. It will take everything you have and give back just as good, because it’s a mirror.
Pamper your little princess with her very own full-length mirror. From the tip of her tiara to her tiny glass slipper, she’ll be dazzled by her own reflection, giving you a moment’s rest.
The solid construction and elegant lines of this full-length mirror make it perfect for a craftsman home.

Princess Cordelia’s second pirate boyfriend was handsome and, relative to other pirates, had good hygiene! Things started off great, but the princess noticed him looking in the mirror all the time; so vain. She promptly sent him on his way, giving him a handful of citrus for any future scurvy outbreaks, and naming all her mirrors after him.
There it is again. The pure, clean lines of an adulterated rectangle. And shining forth from the heart of its simplicity? You. Stunning!
Reflective surface? Yes. Wall hangable? Yes. Everything is there… the only thing missing is you.
Sweet Dreams Are Made Of You

Nothing is more delightful than watching babies discover their reflection. Such surprise-to see themselves alone in a jungle, surrounded by dinosaurs, bunnies and unpredictable elephants with long, reaching trunks…

Stark. Honest. True. You can stare into Sincerity but it will only stare back. It can give nothing that you did not bring to it. If you dislike the answer The Sincerity gives you, ask yourself: do you really know the question? Made from reclaimed trash and highly reflective tin foil.

Who are we, but reflections of our own divine purpose? If you don’t understand, simply close your eyes—and see without seeing. Now, open them. There is a mirror wall cabinet. It is you. You are perfect.
Salvaged from the hull of a downed government aircraft, this mirror shines like no other.
Why buy expensive lie detectors when you can check for vampirism with this one weird trick! A mirror for every occasion.
Astronauts used this for the first selfie in space!

You’ll love the way your reflection looks when it's framed by beautiful, hand-carved walnut. One gaze and you’ll find that person staring back at you irresistible. Let yourself see you the way we see you seeing yourself, with the Vision Of You mirror.

A charming companion to the Weathered Wonder dresser, this antiqued wall mirror is so quaintly battered, it makes you look as fresh and innocent as a flower. Gaze into its depths and admire the tenderness of your reflection. See it. Believe it. Cherish it forever.
This is a straightforward bathroom mirror that will make you look your best while brushing your teeth.
The same simple style you loved in our Morning Glory Bathroom Mirror is now longer to reflect your best self from the top of your head to the tip of your toes.
You don’t need some fancy frame to pretty up your look. You want the raw, honest truth. And this mirror will give it to you.

You can’t get enough of gazing at yourself, so you absolutely need more mirrors! Follow every careless movement, peer shyly into your own sweet eyes, and be sure to toss yourself a backwards glance if you’re ever forced to leave your mirror.
I Only Have Eyes for Me Wall Mirror

The only thing exposed on this medicine cabinet is the hardware. And maybe your face, you know, when you look in the mirror. But anything else you keep behind the glass, stays behind the glass. Novel!
Pain to Pane Mirrored Medicine Cabinet
Meticulously crafted from reclaimed recycled particle board, the aged metal framing features exposed rivets for the ultimate urban effect.
Greet the rising sun with a grin every morning. This cheery kids’ mirror will put your little rooster in the brightest of moods, whether it’s light out yet or not.

The perfect complement to the Forgot My Mission Full-length Mirror, this elegant, Mission-style wall mirror is more decorative than practical. Gaze into its depths and find yourself sliced up. Not a problem for lunchmeat. Sims? You decide.

Princess Cordelia’s second pirate boyfriend was handsome and, relative to other pirates, had good hygiene! Things started off great, but the princess noticed him looking in the mirror all the time; so vain. She promptly sent him on his way, giving him a handful of citrus for any future scurvy outbreaks, and naming all her mirrors after him.

No matter how long the Princess called the Eppsilon home, it was nonetheless a submersible, and like all submersibles, it was made of cold, unforgiving metal. In her sadder moments-most often after dumping a pirate boyfriend-Princess Cordelia favored this hostile glass, which reminded her of her tragic fate. Sigh.

Princess Cordelia’s second pirate boyfriend was handsome and, relative to other pirates, had good hygiene! Things started off great, but the princess noticed him looking in the mirror all the time; so vain. She promptly sent him on his way, giving him a handful of citrus for any future scurvy outbreaks, and naming all her mirrors after him.
Let your star qualities shine. This star-shaped wall mirror is hand-decorated with fuzzy dots to be one-of-a-kind, just like you!
What a Star You Are Wall Mirror
Unlock by reaching level 8 of the Entertainer career while in the Comedy branch.
Unlocked at level 8 of the Entertainer career while in the Comedy branch.
Frame yourself in pure innocence with the Great Wall Mirror. Clean, simple lines never overpower your beauty. Less mirror, more you.

How do Sim children stay so strong and healthy? Why, on Look at Me Monkey Bars, the leading brand in Sim playground equipment! This set is impossible to resist, transforming your little couch potato into a fit little monkey.

Record keeping is never easy, but we, at the Filers for the Dead Files, are happy to know a simple guitar was more than enough for you to sign away your first born. We, and Grim, appreciate your potential deposit, and wish you pleasant days... until we see you again.
Tickle the crowd pink after plucking just a few strings of this rhythm rocker.
Up your cool factor by learning to play guitar! A truly social instrument, guitars such as these have been known to attract small crowds of admirers, wherever they’re played.
Music just sounds better from a handcrafted guitar, unless the handcrafting went badly, in which case it sounds much, much worse.
Autographed by rock legend, Dusty Starlight, this resonant beauty looks awesome, sounds awesome, and makes you even more awesome!
Unlock by reaching level 10 of the Entertainer career while in the Music branch.
Unlocked at level 10 of the Entertainer career while in the Music branch.
Learn to play this ebony dream, and control the mood of entire crowds at the touch of its faux-ivory keys. Gain even more attention by hiring a babe to lie across the top, or just do it yourself.
Go down in musical history with a piano as exqusite as you are. This elegant antiqiue has been fully refurbished and re-gilt, so if your talent doesn’t sparkle, at least your piano can.
Unlock by reaching level 7 of the Entertainer career while in the Music branch.
Unlocked at level 7 of the Entertainer career while in the Music branch.
No need to break the bank on your child’s first violin. Let’s just make it look fun and exciting, in nice bright colors, since it probably won’t sound so good for a while. Only for use by children.
Your child is destined for greatness, and you’ll give anything to ensure their prodigious talents are realized. This violin-this is their ticket. Spare no expense. Only for use by children.
Your child is one of a kind and deserves an instrument as truly unique as they are. This handcrafted violin is so full of character, no one will notice if your child can’t play it.
A classic stringed instrument with a distinctive hour-glass shape, arching neck, and f-holes. It produces crisp, high-pitched notes using a bow drawn across the strings in a sawing motion.
This antique violin was meticulously crafted by a ghost from a legendary artisan family. Its tone could make a stone wall cry.
This scrap-wood violin is actually playable. Maybe.

The Tiny Teacher Nesting Blocks are a perfect way for your toddler to learn about how the world works. Whether they're practicing to become an architect or just learning colors, these blocks are here for them.
This instrument is so intuitive, anyone can play it! But just in case, here you go: Pick it up. Wave it. Listen. Sound!
Experience the wonder of the universe in your own backyard! This full-size observatory comes complete with your very own high-powered telescope, for optimal stargazing and discreet alien watching.
There's nothing better than creating art.
There's nothing better than creating art.
A standing tripod frame used for supporting or displaying an artist's canvas. Handcrafted with pride in Salt Lake City since 2011.

The original owner of this antique easel wasn’t sure what to paint. So, he painted his easel. Supposedly, the experience was so gratifying, he went on to paint his entire studio-chairs, table, floor, walls…

This deluxe painter’s easel not only has a telescoping height and ample support for one’s art, it goes with you when you want to paint your favorite field, over and over all year.

This feather-light easel is a cinch to carry. On breezy days, simply stand back and let the wind do the lifting for you.

What happens if you take a yellow bulb, put a lightning bolt inside of it, surround it with a red circle, and place it on a poster? We don’t know, but our curiosity is buzzing!
Add the warmth and light of the holiday season year-round with this print by artist Holly Daze.
Yeah, putting a framed issue of a magazine touting your company's exploits is pretty egotistical... but if your company is making news, you're worth it!

Little bears know, when the going gets tough, grab your mama bear for a great big bear hug!
They always said, when it happens, magical things will occur. Well, it happened! Are you feeling majestic?
Is she looking back to the sea, or forward to the horizon? What do you see?\n\nI see sadness... because it's pretty tough to eat, with a giant horn sticking out of your nose.
If you're ever feeling down... think about taking a trip to Paradise Falls. Aside from a really depressing introduction, it's a pretty up place.

Even though our shoes don't feature prominently in this poster, our marketing team tells us that pictures of famous athletes are the best way to sell products. Prove those marketing geniuses right, and buy some Sole Star Shoes today!

Tragic Clown, Tragic Clown...What have they done to you?

Another creation by Angelo from his series "Perspectives on Clowns." This piece showcases the sad lives of clowns that fear that one balloon pop that could end their careers.

It is rumored that Angelo painted this in honor of his phobia of people wearing heavy makeup, but we think he may have a phobia for balloons as well.

Her name is Amber, she's the girl next door. It's Amber! She's a painter, yeah! She's an artist. She leaves others confused. She's a neat freak. She scrubs toilets right after they're... used? A gamer. A lover. She hacks like no other! She dances to cure the blues. Her name is Amber. Amber. Her name is Amber. That girl next door. Who? Amber!

He never drinks more than two cups of coffee a day. One New Years Eve, he stayed up until midnight. When the going gets tough, he watches daytime TV. If at first he doesn't succeed, he doesn't try again. He is the most least interesting Sim in the world. He doesn't always eat breakfast, but when he does, he makes pancakes.
A mascot without a team... but a llama with a partner! With these two on the case, the bad guys don't stand a chance. Cop and Llama!
This flu season, the doctors are IN!
A hero will rise with one mission... To decorate her home with nothing but wood. Epic wood!
A love so strong it stops time.

The intricate tapestries hand-woven by Bembe Maraj are world-renowned for their use of color, design, and story. Each is carefully inlaid with a vision of his past—though, to most sims, these stories remain hidden behind geometric motif and vibrant colors.

Give your baby a window into prehistoric times with this charming little dinosaur painting. Reduced to 0.3% of its actual size, this pleasing herbivore is as harmless as they come, but we locked it behind glass just to be safe.
A portrait of a cheerful elephant to enliven your nursery or playroom.
Did you know that the average ladybug can eat 5,000 other bugs in its lifetime? We think that’s why her eyes are bulging. The artist captured this happy little critter on bug 4,999. Darling!
This adorable little rabbit is so lifelike, you can almost see its nose twitching. What, what’s that? What does it smell? Oh, of course. Diapers!
The only thing kids love more than trees is cotton candy! Your child will be the envy of all when you decorate his room with cotton candy trees!

Too often we force ourselves to label what we see, what we hear, taste and touch. Here is a painting. Is it a good painting? Before you apply that label, consider that definition destroys exploration, allows us to sit back and dust off our hands and say “all done.” Art is never done being art!
Blast off to your happy place with every glance at this devilish pinup. 3…2…1. See? You’re smiling.

Proof is a prison from which curiosity languishes and dies, its limp arm dangling between the bars of its cell where it once stretched toward the light of freedom. Art is the key that unlocks the cell door and liberates our captive minds, daring them to run as fast as they can.

Reclamation Homeware truly understands art. Art is simply defined as man’s last hope to crawl out from the shadows of fact and expose himself to the piercing light of infinity. It challenges us to climb mental ladders and dive into unknown expanses of self. Plus, ours is made of garbage!
Not all scientists advocate string theory to explain our universe. But all interior designers think this artful depiction of quantum mechanics would go awesome with your wallpaper.

Transport yourself to the beautiful countryside! Just one glance at this landscape, and you will feel as if your entire home has been whisked off on a romantic getaway. Lounge in the spacious square, savor the mist of the fountain on your skin, revel in the majestic chimes of the clock, and feel your heart skip into the hills beyond.

Nothing cheers up a home like a gallant coq. Jolly, proud and bursting with character, this friendly fellow brings a smile to everyone he greets. Admire him from across the room or step in close to absorb his finer details.

So much more than a still life, this elegant painting piques the appetite with the softly lit curves of its tantalizing fruit. Smooth, firm golden pears bump up against the flirtatious pink petals of a carefully arranged bouquet, which nestles contentedly on a bed of white linen.

Picture yourself lying in a field of sunflowers, gazing up at the brilliant blue of the sky. A migraine is coming on, but you are too relaxed to mind. Instead, you admire how the sparkling pre-headache aura dances across the merry yellow petals of the flowers, which arch delightedly toward the warmth of the summer sun. Now keep the picture.

Transport yourself completely to a historic country village with this large, sweeping, lifelike landscape. Offering a broader view than Viva La Landscape , Viva More of La Landscape reveals the full fountain in all its thundering grandeur, and a convenient, charming hotel beyond.
Express your love for nature with this charming collection of bird prints. Each fanciful feathered friend is a treasure, but flocked together, they are the epitome of contemporary chick-chic.
Birds of a Feather Print Set
At the end of every dark tunnel is a ray of light. This radiant painting ensures you don’t forget it.
Unlock by reaching level 9 of the Tech Guru career while in the Start-up branch.
Unlocked at level 9 of the Tech Guru career while in the Start-up branch.
This mesmerizing masterpiece was inspired by the world-famous forest fire that destroyed thousands of acres in the 1920s. A study of dark and light, sobriety and celebration, this piece is profound.
Snow Falling on Cinders Abstract Art

A meditation of creation and balance set against a backdrop of cosmic wonder. Princess Cordelia's astronomers were forced to scour the skies until they found a nebula in the shape of her favorite horse. Nearby, a fire raged on.

Stickiness is harsh white lines on a glutinous peach and blueberry dessert. Texture is a sharp and fleeting sensorial dance. What is edible becomes re-edible. Mochi Booger Parade. A new painting by new age artist/chef/writer StickiMo.
Suggestive to some of a crimson zebra and others a sunlit forest, this print adds a dash of color to any modern home. Also doubles as a Rorschach test for friends and visitors.

One of these Plumbobs is not like the others
One of these Plumbobs is kind of the same
Can you guess which one of these is not like the others?
So many Plumbobs, So little space!

Have you ever wondered how many Plumbobs can fit in a painting? Where the giant Plumbob is king, how many do you really see?\n\nThis masterpiece by renowned artist Rombuserat, evokes play and exposes the senses to a minimalist yet thought provoking piece. Perfect for commemorating the Sims' 16th Anniversary! Celebrate with us!
Show off your affinity for architecture with this hand-drawn elevation of a Roman temple. Drawn to scale long after the fall of the noble empire, it has little other use than to glorify your wall.
Inspire a love for reading with this cheery kids’ poster. A true breath of fresh air, this artsy poster depicts a garden of books growing strong-just like your child’s IQ will!
Take a trip back to Mars with every glance at this lovely landscape. Red rock canyons, blue sky…. Hmm. Maybe it’s not Mars, but it IS reminiscent, isn’t it?
Recall the glaciers and snowcapped mountains from that memorable trip to Mars. Or, maybe not Mars. But somewhere that's memorable.
What a great vacation on Mars that was, whether climbing to the top of an active volcano or lazing on a pristine beach. That was Mars, wasn't it?
The chef's domain: sweltering, clouded in smoke, heavy with the moans of wait staff. The perfect poster for an aspiring epicurean!
Emerging from the shadows with no history, no past, and no name. The Mysterious Gamer! A poster commemorating this icon of gaming lore.
Unlock by reaching level 8 of the Tech Guru career while in the Gamer branch.
Unlocked at level 8 of the Tech Guru career while in the eSport Gamer branch.
Virtually smell the aroma of overturned dirt and sweaty teenagers with this poster!
An absolute must for any girl with big dreams. Talented, airbrushed, and sooo stylish, she’s everything a girl aspires to be, and more!
Everyone’s favorite kid wizard has graduated from books to movies and now to your wall! Cast a spell and bewitch your friends with the mystifying power of Henry Puffer.
No teenage bedroom is complete without a poster of the latest bad-boy music sensation taped haphazardly to the wall. Rock on.
This high heel in silhouette makes it clear that you know what's hot and what's not.
Show off your passion for soccer with this poster of women’s soccer legend Sally Upstart. As big a name as a female athlete has ever been, she’s kicking doors open for girls like you. Score!
Working out takes motivation--and this poster provides it in spades!
This anonymous photograph of conifers on an alpine slope is ideal for giving your home a well-travelled look. And since it's anonymous, you can always take credit.
Hang your intellect on the wall for all your friends to see. This reproduction of an Old World map was hand-painted on aged parchment in an ancient language few can remember-and you’re one of them!
This collection features faithful reproductions of patents for the greatest scientific inventions of all time, including the telescope, wheel, and navel lint remover.
No one’s quite sure who this guy is, but does it matter? It’s fine art, and it’s old, and that’s cool, right?

Countdown to blast-off with this ready-to-hang print! Made by an artist no older than your little one, this rocket shape was carved out of potato, dipped in paint, and then stamped onto construction paper. But you get to enjoy it without all that mess.
Look what your little artist can do! Or maybe someone else’s. But it may as well be yours, right?
This eye-popping painting celebrates nature in all its glory. Gaze admiringly at its vibrant hues, and it will gaze right back at you.
Post this growth chart featuring a tottering stack of blocks on the wall of your little one's bedroom and keep track of her vertical progression from baby to teen.

Whoever said you can’t teach robots to make art didn’t spend enough time tuning his robots. Our robots can paint a pleasing landscape with brush strokes so precise, you will be able to appreciate their work within a margin of error of plus or minus .007 art appreciation units.
Colorful primroses rendered in oil pastels brighten any room. Bonus: no need to water, trim or replace the blossoms as they fade.

One thing Princess Cordelia simply couldn’t fit on her submersible was her beloved jazz band. She so missed the music of her former life that she painted a series of pictures to commemorate it. This lively number was inspired by the sax legend Jacob Goldentips, who was left tragically adrift during The Great Sloth Invasion.

When Princess Cordelia was forced to flee her kingdom, she had to leave her beloved jazz band behind. This wistful silhouette portrays the sax legend Jacob Goldentips still playing in the depths of the sea, which was how the Princess liked to imagine him.

Even a submersible as grand as the Eppsilon has its limitations. Princess Cordelia had to cast out many employees, including her beloved jazz band. She longed for their music so deeply that she painted a series of pictures as a tribute. This silhouette portrays bass player Martin Maxwell still playing in the depths of the sea. So poignant!

When The Great Sloth Invasion forced Princess Cordelia to flee, she simply couldn’t fit everyone on her submersible. But firing her beloved jazz band remained a regret so sharp, she painted a series of pictures to honor them. This wistful silhouette portrays one of her musicians still playing blues in the deep blue (purplish) sea.
The silhouette of a saxophonist stands tall in this jazzy piece of art.
Rendered in temperate painterly hues, a cool jazz trumpeter plays a sophisticated tune.

When Princess Cordelia was forced to flee her kingdom, she simply couldn’t fit her beloved musicians on the submersible. This colorful portrait is a tribute to her bass player Martin Maxwell, and somehow made her feel less blue.
Blue for the Blues Wall Painting

Princess Cordelia loved piano most of all. Though she had cut her jazz band adrift during her escape from her kingdom, she continued to ache for their music, and so found herself painting instruments. The piano keys in this tribute seem to arch up toward the light, almost as if lifted by the current. Apt, isn’t it?
Great jazz is hard to come by, especially in the depths of the sea, so Princess Cordelia commissioned a mute reproduction of glorious jazz music.

One thing the Princess was thrilled to leave back in her former kingdom was cats. They shed everywhere and made her sneeze! But nostalgia is a funny thing, and so the princess found herself painting them. As you can tell from this design, her portrayals were a touch romantic.
Jazz Cats: Whiskers of a Forgotten Past

Some days, the thought of her long-lost jazz musicians was simply too much for Princess Cordelia to bear. She even went so far as to have new instruments made, but with no one to play them, all she could do was paint pictures of them.

Just like music, art can be a celebration-of things we love, of experiences we adore, of people left behind. This abstract painting is a beautiful reverie, a nostalgic tribute to the ne’er-to-be-forgotten performances of years past.

Not all of Princess Cordelia’s entertainers perished in the Great Sloth Invasion. This pianist knew that if his body was to perish, his name must live on for him. So, he rolled his piano out atop the submersible and played until it went under.

Princess Cordelia painted this before gradually fleeing from the giant sloths. Photographs were not commonplace yet, so this painting was all she had to remind her of her old palace’s painting studio. While sitting comfortably on her escape submarine, she changed the name from “Flower Still Life,” to “Land-Coral Garden.”

Of course, there were no flowers in Princess Cordelia’s subaquatic life, but she had an acute memory of the vases and vases of them that once adorned the Royal House. Oh, the fragrance! Princess Cordelia couldn’t replicate the scent of course, but her painting was quite lifelike.

When Princess Cordelia was forced to flee her kingdom, she had to leave her beloved jazz band behind. Framed in a celebratory gold frame, this wistful silhouette portrays the sax legend Jacob Goldentips still playing in the depths of the sea, which was how the Princess liked to imagine him. [Must be placed on at least a two-story wall.]
Ode to Jazz Wall Painting 2: “Goldentips” in Gold

One thing Princess Cordelia simply couldn’t fit on her submersible was her beloved jazz band. She so missed their music that she painted a series of pictures to commemorate it. Framed in celebratory gold frames, this collection reunites three of her favorite musicians-may they play together in peace on your wall.

Painting the most ordinary things can take extraordinary talent. In this masterpiece, the artist has depicted an astonishingly vast array of objects. It is said he began with two apples, but took so long to finish, he devoured one halfway through.
Still Life with Apple and Pitcher and Books and Bottles and Flowers
Unlock by reaching level 3 of the Writer career.
Unlocked at level 3 of the Writer career.

Before painting his most famous opus, artist Jean-Jacques PePe did sketch after sketch of his maîtresse Jeanne. She grew so old in the process, he had to start over with her daughter Deanne. These sketches are from the 27th year of sitting, and include a rare male form.
Unlock by reaching level 3 of the Painter career.
Unlocked at level 3 of the Painter career.

Pop art is for everyone, and this famous Amy Warthog print is especially for you! Featuring the unmistakable face of everyone’s favorite furry friend, the piece is as iconic and unforgettable as the artist herself.
I Otter Be a Star Pop Art
Unlock by reaching level 5 of the Entertainer career while in the Comedy branch.
Unlocked at level 5 of the Entertainer career while in the Comedy branch.

Celebrate technical achievement with this tech spec wall poster, featuring the hot and cold buttons on the world’s first pet hair dryer. The oversized hot button reflects a genius adjustment made by guru Fuzzy James, after the pets all got colds in the first round of testing.
Unlock by reaching level 7 of the Criminal career while in the Oracle branch.
Unlocked at level 7 of the Criminal career while in the Oracle branch.
Tickle your fancy with this nature-inspired print. Soft, illusory and delightfully mysterious, it leaves you with a fluttering in your stomach-and on your wall.
These brilliant watercolors capture the very essence of what makes an apple an apple, and a pear a pear.
Artist Kun Li’s work takes recognizable objects from nature and divorces them from their natural environments, in order to force the viewer to see them in a new light.
Discontent with a mere still life, artist Kun Li set these pears in motion, combining a study of form with a study of basic physics.
This painting is one of 364 painted over the course of a single year as a study of changing light through the seasons. Unfortunately, a bad case of indigestion cost the artist a day in March.

Go from nouveau riche to old money with this impressive collection. Featuring “family” portraits and a few compelling landscapes, this array of paintings was carefully curated to suggest art that has been inherited over generations, and not just purchased in a clever box set.

This handsome couple was painted in their first year of marriage, long before the dame let her delectable figure go and the monsieur began his affair with the maid. But in the painting at least, their love is preserved forever. Beautiful, n’est ce pas?
This Mission-style parapet with terracotta edging and quatrefoil embellishment lends gravitas to your roofline. And who wants a roofline without gravitas?
Shaped Mission Roof Parapet with Quatrefoil
This parapet doesn't exactly raise the roof of your Mission-style dwelling, but it certainly looks the part.
Put your love on a pedestal. Or your dog, or your boss... That’s the nice thing about this pedestal. You decide what goes on it.

Due to its cheap price, this camera is often purchased as a gift for fledgling photographers; however, with picture quality only a smidge better than what a standard smartphone is equipped with, this camera generally ends up as a paperweight. Mostly bought by out of touch family members who are too cheap to go for even middle of the line stuff.

Made for the true perfectionist, the Crystal Clear Digital Camera is the most accurate photo taking device on the market today. Capturing over a gajillion pixels per photo, viewers will be able to see every tiny detail of every photo taken. Just don't expect to take many photos. That kind of quality comes with a price, and the price is that this camera can only hold 10 pictures at a time.

Does your baby or dog pose so adorably that you simply must capture every single moment? Is your phone so overloaded with baby and dog pics that you don't have space for apps? Pick up the Appreciably Average Digital Camera and free yourself to take as many pictures of your baby riding your dog like a cowboy as you could possibly want!
The sweetest swamp grass you'll ever see!
This grass moves freely with the wind.
This grass is a hybrid developed in a bontanical garden.
This grass is commonly found in nature.
A planter box filled with colorful flowers.
This grass is native to the Sylvan Glade.
The grass is only found in mysterious glades...
It's whispered that this grass attracts faeries...
The best way to keep neighbors out of your business? Shrubs in the shape of the last neighbor, slightly overgrown.
An even better privacy shield than its taller companion, this bushy bush not only prevents snooping, it discourages upstanding citizens from actually wanting to know.
Otherwise known as the Aphrodite azalea, this pink-petalled beauty is rumored to throw visitors into fits of passion. Enhance your garden with its splendor, but accept that it’s prone to wander.
Every day is springtime with these happy purple perennials. Gaze at their smiling blossoms and start each morn renewed.

The color of danger and stop signs, of lipstick and race cars, of clown’s lips and match tips—red flowers are thrilling, passionate, exciting. Red flowers set the heart pounding, while whispering “Beware.”
Kind of like a “Keep Out” sign, just…leafier.
Surround yourself in fragrant romance with a delightful hedge of lavender.
Known for its vigorous growth, this domineering beauty is hard to keep within bounds. Tend it with care, or it’ll take over more than your yard.
Born to be wild, this grass defies mowing, in case you were actually thinking of getting off the couch.
Line your garden with dollops of blue, as if the sky were dripping daintily onto your pretty hedge.
Bright and beautiful, just like you, hydrangeas can actually be quite fickle, changing color at the least provocation. Unlike others, ours stay blue, or so we’ll say for now.

Add interest to your garden with the dullest daisies ever created. Cultivated by botanist Anna Grump after the death of her fifth husband, these rare daisies are the crowning glory of her illustrious career.
Like bright bursts of sunshine, this merry shrub adds splendor to one’s garden and joy to one’s heart.
Grow a garden as untamed as you! These feral flowers are Mother Nature’s masterpiece. Why try to outdo her?
Hedge rows are quite practical for dividing yards, creating mazes and writing messages large enough for aliens to read.
It’s like a little touch of the tropics crawled in and took residence at your house.
Dappled with sunny flowers, this lovely shrub is secretly a slug repellent. Watch them sizzle and shrivel to a crisp.
Enrobe your garden in dainty pastel beauty with these fabulous flowering plants. Swoon over their delicate aroma, but watch your head on the planter on the way down.
Add drama to any space with these immense, fiery red-orange blossoms ringed in flame yellow. Extinguish with water when done.
This flower will last far into the future. Thousands of years, no doubt. "Perennial" indeed.
This flower will last far into the future. Thousands of years, no doubt. "Perennial" indeed.
This flower will last far into the future. Thousands of years, no doubt. "Perennial" indeed.
This flower flares with personality. You might even say that it’s quite a looker. Maybe even to the point of being callous.

When we got these as seeds, we thought they were orchids. Each time one bloomed, we said, “Oops, a daisy!”
Known for its razor-sharp teeth and voracious appetite, the hedera canariensis is as deadly as it is green. Luckily, this version has been neutered into a harmless plant for landscaping your home.

These flowers are proud of their own petals and will bring honor to your garden.
Often confused with a common aster, these stellar blooms are clearly... aster nots.
Known for being delicious. If these were food, one bite and you'd be smiling all day. While enduring severe stomach cramps.
Fall head over heels for these flaming pink blossoms, and enjoy a lifetime of love, with a plant.
Known for being delicious. If these were food, one bite and you'd be smiling all day. While enduring severe stomach cramps.
