Observant Sims learn the traits of others just by meeting them.
Sims that are Naturalists don't need to fear fire; it won't touch them, and they can extinguish it with ease.
These Sims gain powerful Moodlets from Friendly socialization, have their Social Need decay quickly, and gain more negative Moodlets when their Social Need is low.
Expressionistic Sims have captured the essence of feeling, and can create highly emotional works of art regardless of their actual mood!
{M0.Patriarch}{F0.Matriarch}s provide skill boosts whenever they are around their children.
(From Completing the Big Happy Family Aspiration)
Perfect Hosts get a boost to the score of any social event they throw.
These Sims take longer to craft items but tend to make them higher quality, gain powerful Moodlets after crafting a high quality item, and gain negative Moodlets after crafting a low quality item.
Physically Gifted Sims build adult physical skills faster.
Pipers know an arsenal of songs that have significant power over others.
Players will never cause other Sims to get jealous, no matter what they do
Potion Masters can mix potent drinks which can sway the drinker's emotions.
Professional Slackers have no fear of being demoted or fired.
Quick Learners build all skills a little bit faster!
Sims with Angler's Tranquility will find that all of their problems seem to melt away while they are fishing.
These Sims tend to be Flirty and may become Sad if they don't have any Romantic social interactions for a period of time.
Savants gain all skills much faster!
Seldom Sleepy Sims need less sleep than other Sims.
These Sims tend to be Confident.
Shameless Sims will never get Embarrassed!
Sincere Sims have more success with Apologies and Compliments.
These Sims are not affected by dirty surroundings and make household items dirtier faster.
These Sims can Critique Work on low quality items, are bored by "low brow" television, and gain Confidence around other Snob Sims.
Socially Gifted Sims build adult social skills faster.
Speed Cleaners tidy up much faster!
Speed Readers read books faster than your average Sim.
Sims with a Steel Bladder rarely have to pay attention to their Bladder Need.
Super Green Thumbs will find that the plants they garden have amazing vitality!
Handy Sims can instantly Fix and Upgrade any object.
Idyllic, easygoing Toddlers. They are never defiant and they don't throw a tantrum. They can easily talk to strangers.
These Toddlers love to socialize. They earn Communication skill faster, and don't suffer Stranger Danger from strangers. They can Share the Love with other Sims.
These shy Toddlers avoid Sims outside the household and get sad if left behind. They gain extra skill when taught. And they recover faster from bad moods when Comforted.
Tiny trouble-makers who love to Cry, cause trouble, and Throw Fits. But being noticed makes them Happy and helps them overcome negative Moodlets.
These Toddlers love their freedom, and don't like to take orders from caregivers. They gain extra skill when they are left alone, and need less Attention than other Toddlers.
Curious explorers. These Toddlers gain Thinking skill slightly faster. They are happiest when learning something, and sad if they haven't learned anything lately.
Goofy and curious. These Toddlers love to tell jokes and get Playful. They earn Imagination skill slightly faster.
Spirited and full of Energy. These Toddlers love to explore and get Energized. They earn Movement skill slightly faster. They get Sad if they haven't been outside in a while.
{0.SimFirstName} got such a strong jump on skills as a toddler, they improve all other skills extra fast.
Thrifty Sims receive a 10% rebate on all Build Mode purchases made each week. Rebates will be directly applied to Household Funds.
Webmasters get the most out of their computers, unlocking extremely useful ways to use them.
Domestic Sims will see their familial relationships grow stronger faster.
When creating Sims in CAS, you select an initial Aspiration Track to put that character on a suggested progression path.
Aspirations are mid- to long-range goals for Sims that help guide them through their lifetime.

Selecting an Aspiration Track is not a permanent decision - Sims can pursue any and all Aspiration tracks at once.\n\nSelecting an Aspiration to track will displays Notifications when those objectives are completed.
Welcome to The Sims 4 Lessons!\n\nSelect a category from the list to the left. Then choose a topic to learn more about it.
You can prevent an embarrassing moment by directing your Sim to Use the Toilet.
Sims will take care of their Bladder Need if you let them and they are able to do so!
Sims will take care of their Energy Need if you let them and they are able to do so!
Sims require sleep every day in a bed, chair, or even on the floor.
If you don't let your Sims sleep, they'll eventually pass out.
Take quick naps or drink coffee when your Sims don't have time for a proper sleep.
Sims require entertainment from time to time, else they grow miserably bored!
Sims will take care of their Fun Need if you let them and they are able to do so!
Sims can have fun playing games, reading, watching TV, and more!
Better fun items cost more Simoleons, but are well worth the investment!
Sims need to eat food a few times every day or they might die of Hunger! Eat snacks or prepare meals for increased nourishment.
Sims will take care of their Hunger Need if you let them and they are able to do so!
If your Sim is low on time, Have a Quick Meal from the Fridge or Microwave.
Sims who take the time to cook a proper meal will not only enjoy it more, but they'll learn in the process!
Sims will take care of their Hygiene Need if you let them and they are able to do so!
Sims require the occasional splash of water on their skin. Try taking a Bath or Shower.
Hygienic Sims will be happier and more successful socially.
Washing your hands via the sink is only a temporary solution, but every bit helps!
Sims will take care of their Social Need on their own if you let them and they are able to do so!
Sims require Sim-to-Sim interaction, else they go a little crazy.
Call a Sim over to your Sim's home or travel to a community lot (like the gym!) to meet Sims in person.
In a pinch, call a Sim or chat via the computer to fill your Sim's Social Need slightly.
Pregnant Sims will have adjusted physical needs and Emotions. It may get rocky at times, but it's worth the effort!
When your Sim's pregnancy is at an end, the baby will be born. Be ready at any moment! Your Sim will receive a Birth Certificate that you can place on the wall!
So, you want to know if you are having a baby... your Sim can take a Pregnancy test by interacting on the toilet to really be sure, or, you can just wait to see what happens.

The Bassinet is an essential object expecting parents should purchase for their newborn.\n\nIf you don't purchase a bassinet, don't worry, your baby will still arrive in their very own (or maybe two if you have twins!).
To view all of your Achievements, enter Live Mode, open the Options Menu, and choose Achievements from the menu.
You can also use the Achievements tracker to help guide you in your exploration of The Sims 4. Maybe you'll find out something you didn't know existed in the game by reading the Achievement goal.

Achievements are goals for you to work towards across multiple households and save files (Achievements are saved per EA Account).\n\nNote: In some cases, you will be unable to gain an Achievement by playing only one household.
And don't forget, give babies plenty of love!
Babies will need to be cleaned often as well as they aren't yet potty trained.
Be sure to bottle or breast feed babies to provide nourishment.
When your Sim is in a negative Emotion, you can help them recover\n\nThe Emotional Whim can always help you find a way to deal with your emotions.
Negative Emotions like Sadness and Anger will change your Sim's behavior and outlook on life. At least temporarily.
New interactions become available and others disappear based on your Sims' emotions.
Negative emotions should be seen as a challenge and a goal to solve. Experiment as your Sims cruise the emotional landscape!
When your Sim is ready for the big moment, have them Blow Out the candles on their Birthday Cake and watch them transition to their next set of life experiences!
You can also use the Birthday Cake to age up your friends and neighbors, just in case you want them to always be the same age as you.
Any cake can be a Birthday Cake.\n\nBake a cake, click on it and choose Add Birthday Candles.
Try burning different things in the bonfire! You can live drag objects in the Sim's inventory to experiment. Sims with traits may even react to what's being burnt!
Find all the secrets that the bonfire holds! Sims with high mischief can use the voodoo doll to mess with other Sims. Having a ghost possess it can also be a sight to behold.
The Bonfire allows Sims to hang out with friends or cozy up next to that special someone. It'll burn bright and colorfully!
Your Sims are emotional beings. And their Moodlets drive their emotions.

Some Moodlets will be multi-colored, these are Happy Emotion Moodlets, or Bonus Moodlets. If you are currently in any Emotion other than Happy, Bonus Moodlets will enhance your current Emotion.\n\nNote: Hover over your Moodlets to see their effect, how you got them, and what Emotion they are boosting.
Interactions in the game can push different Moodlets upon your Sims. Brush your teeth, and you might be feeling Minty Fresh. Neglect your hygiene, and you might be Grungy.
Each Moodlet has an emotion strength associated with it. Your Sim determines their current Emotion based on the Moodlets they have.
Software has bugs. The etymology of the term "bug" is greatly debated, although it is an accepted fact that it predates software.
What is a bug? Everything from a software crash, a freeze, or a memory leak; to grammatical errors, missing user interface data, and clipping.
We apologize if you find a bug. We hope that you can forgive us for not finding it ourselves.
At least one Sim in your household should have a career, especially if you are a new player.
Careers encourage your Sims to meet new Sims and learn new skills.

Your Sims will perform better at their career if they go to work in the suggested emotion.\n\nYou can hover over the Career Performance meter in the Career panel to view information about the ideal emotion, as well as how to improve career performance.
Sims can get a career by using a computer or their phone.\n\nYou can also open your Career panel and choose Join a Career.
Make sure you always choose the right outfit for every occasion your story needs.\n\nClick on your Sim and choose Change Outfits... to pick a new outfit for your Sim to wear.
Some things will switch your Sims outfit automatically (sleeping, working out, being the groom or bride in a wedding).\n\nIf you don't like the outfit chosen, you can always change the outfit.
Click on your Sim or a Dresser and choose Change Outfit... to change the outfit your Sim is currently wearing.\n\nTo modify the outfits, click on a Dresser and choose Plan Outfit.
Body & Facial Modifications are off limits.\n\nThe Muscle and Fat sliders in Create a Sim update based on your Sims experiences, you can see how your Sims are doing.
When you are done modifying your Sims, click the Play button to return to Live Mode.
Plan Outfit will take you to Create a Sim, however you will not be able to edit some parts of your Sims.\n\nYou can modify Outfits, Accessories, as well as Hair.

Sims can die if their Needs are neglected for too long, if they push their Sims too far down an emotional path, or as the result of failing certain risky interactions.

Or fire. Fire can kill too. Yep, fire.

I mentioned fire, right?
Upon death: the Grim Reaper comes to usher them from the game, leaving behind a memorial Urn or Gravestone which nearby Sims can use to mourn.
Sims in a Group will be represented by a clear Icon over their head. You can have up to eight Sims in a Group.
Sims love to do things together, and what better way than to do them in a Group? Group behavior is much easier to control and more visible than ever.
Groups will automatically be formed when you travel with other Sims, or Invite them over to the current lot. Dates will also form an exclusive Group for the duration of the date!
You can start a Group by selecting another Sim, selecting Actions, and Add to Group. Disbanding the Group or Removing Sims from the Group can also be found in Actions.
Experiment by designing rooms in your Sims' homes to improve their moods when creating, exercising, and more!
Sims are affected negatively by things like dirty dishes, broken household items, and puddles.

Some decorative items will affect your Sim's current emotion. For example, if a painting is inspiring, have your Sim view the painting to become inspired.\n\nNote: An objects catalog hovertip will inform you if it will have an emotional impact on your Sims.
Fishing Holes can be found all over the world. Click on the Fishing Hole and begin Fishing to raise your Fishing skill.\n\nFishing skill is also improved by Fishing, and Reading about Fishing.
Increasing your Fishing skill will unlock Fish with Bait and increase the likelihood of catching bigger and better fish.\n\nProTip: There are some fish only found in hidden locations.
Bills arrive in the mailbox. They can be paid via the computer, your phone, or on the mailbox.\n\nYou will get a notification reminder before your bills become late.
Not paying bills will result in the possible loss of your utilities, such as power or water.
As Sims buy more items and increase the value of their home, their bills will increase.
Positive emotions should be seen as an opportunity to accomplish great things. Experiment as your Sims navigate the emotional landscape.
New interactions become available and others disappear based on your Sims' emotions.
Different positive Emotions convey different benefits. For example, Inspired sims are better at creative activities.
Experiment with different activities to discover new positive Emotions. Be sure to inspect the Emotion's benefit by hovering over your Sims portrait in the HUD, to take full advantage of them.
Sims with higher Fitness Skill can Mentor and Train others of lower Fitness Skill.
Sims in the Energized Emotion will generally exercise better.
Athletic Sims lead healthier lives and will push back any excess weight gain from over-eating.
Sims improve relationships when having positive social interactions with other Sims.
Socializing with other Sims is a great way to improve your Sim's Social Need.
The better the relationship, the more interesting the social possibilities available to your Sim!
A secondary relationship bar will appear to track your Romance. Your relationship with other Sims change as a result of both friendship and romance levels.
Successfully Romancing with a Sim improves the romantic aspect of their relationship.
Different relationships offer different and interesting social possibilities available to your Sims. Begin exploring all the Romance options!

Left click on a Sim in the Skewer to select them. You can also use the [spacebar] to switch between the Sims in your household.\n\nRight click on the thumbnail of a Sim to set the camera to Follow Mode (an icon will indicate who you are following). Now when your Sim moves, you will follow them. Just move your camera to unset Follow Mode.

The Sim thumbnails that appear at the bottom left of the screen, which include your household members, is called the Skewer.\n\nThe Skewer provides quick access to information about all the Sims in your Household, as well as the ability to issue commands to them.
The Home icon will appear when your Sim is away from their home lot. Clicking this will send them home.
The color background of a Sims thumbnail will indicate their current Emotion.

An Away Action icon appears for Sims who are not currently on the same Street. Clicking it will open different options for you to direct your Sims from afar (socialize, care for self, or other). The available options depend on where they are (at work, visiting friends, etc...).\n\nYou can also choose to bring that Sim to you, or send yourself to that Sim through this menu.
Sims in the Focused emotion will generally be better at Mixology.
The Mixology skill is crucial for hosting Great Parties and is very useful in some careers.
Crafting drinks improves your Sim's Mixology skill, which unlocks new, more powerful drink recipes that are sure to delight and even change a Sim's Emotions.
Some careers will require high levels of Charisma skill, so be sure to direct your Sims to improve this and have plenty of friends!
Charisma is built by executing positive Social interactions and developing friendships.
The Comedy skill allows you to Write Jokes on the computer, laying the groundwork for becoming a hilarious comedian.
Eventually, your comedic timing will increase to the point where you can start writing actual Comedy Routines at the computer.
Sims with a high Comedy skill will be able to Perform Routines at a Microphone to the delight (or annoyance) of other Sims.
Cooking improves your Sims' Cooking skill, unlocks new Recipes, and allows your Sims to prepare tastier, more fulfilling food.
Higher quality kitchen appliances also lead to better quality food.
Sims with the Focused emotion will generally prepare better food.

Having a high Gardening skill allows you to Evolve plants. There are five Evolutions in total, stage one being normal and stage five being perfect. The more evolved your plant, the more valuable their harvest will become.

Once you become skilled enough, you will be able to combine plants by taking a cutting from one plant and grafting it to another. Doing this will cause the plant to grow both crops from one plant. It may also create special seeds.

When you plant your first seed click on it to Water, Weed, or Spray for Insects. Your plant's visual state should provide information about what it needs. Your plant's happiness is determined by three factors: Infestation, Water, and Weeds.\n\nThe better you take care of your plant, the faster you can Evolve it.

To have your Sim start gardening, you will need to acquire some seeds. Seeds can be purchased through Planter Boxes found in Build Mode or from a computer.\n\nPurchased seeds can be found in your Sim's inventory.
As you level your Gardening skill you will gain access to new gardening techniques such as fertilizing or splicing. All of which you can use to become the best agriculturalist you can be.

There are several ways you can speed the evolution process of your plant. Fertilization is often the fastest method. You can Fertilize plants with almost anything--from fruits to fish. The more valuable your Fertilizer, the more of a boost your plant will get.
Sims with a higher level Guitar skill will learn new, more challenging Songs, new musical interactions, and will be able to Write Songs.
Sims who write Songs via the Guitar can license them on the Mailbox to earn Royalty Payments.
Sims in the Inspired emotion will generally be better Guitarists.
Logically the fourth slide should not exist, but here it is.
Play Chess or Read a Book to begin your journey of logical pursuits. Sims with a stronger Logic skill will be better at Playing Chess.
Sims in the Focused emotion will generally find it easier to keep their mind logically focused.
The Logic skill benefits Sims in some careers and in Interactions like Hacking via the computer.
Mischief is mainly tied to Social interactions and the Voodoo Doll. The easiest way to begin your adventure in Mischief is to click on another Sim and choose a Social from Mischief.
Increasing this Skill will unlock new Mischievous socials on Sims and Mischievous interactions on the VooDoo Doll, Computer, and Phone.
Sims with higher Painting skill are able to work in different styles and create better paintings.
Sims in the Inspired Emotion will generally paint better, but explore all of the emotions while painting to bring out your inner artist.
Sims who are good enough at Painting could sell their paintings as an alternate career!

Higher quality paintings can provide powerful Emotional benefits.\n\nHave your Sim paint while in an Emotion, hang your creation on a wall, and choose View to recreate the Emotions imbued within the paint into your Sim.
Sims with a higher level Piano skill will learn new, more challenging Songs, new musical interactions, and will be able to Write Songs.
Sims who write songs via the piano can license them on the mailbox to earn royalty payments.
Sims in the Inspired Emotion will generally be better pianists.
Increasing the Programming skill will allow Sims to create Plugins, Games, Mods, and Mobile Phone Apps.\n\nExperienced programmers will also be able to Hack to make a few Simoleons.

Programming begins on the Computer. Click on the Computer and choose the Programming… menu. You can also purchase a book from the Bookshelf to learn the basics.\n\nNote: Skilled programmers can Mentor others to help them increase their skill.
Increasing the Rocket Science skill will increase your build speed and unlock new Upgrades for your Rocket Ship.
Space, a frontier. Some say the final one--but not the Rocket Scientist! Sims with the Rocket Science skill see space as only the beginning!
The Rocket Science skill is built using the Rocket Ship. What Rocket Ship? That's classified.\n\nOr… you could try being an Astronaut.
Choose Play Game from an objects Pie Menu. Playing will build Fun, but can cause Fatigue, so take a break every once in awhile.\n\nReal world tip: Blink.
Sims gain the Video Gaming Skill by playing on the Computer, Motion Gaming system, Tablet, and Phone.
Increasing your Sim's Video Gaming skill will unlock new Socials, as well as new Interactions on the Computer.
Sims who write Songs via the Violin can License them on the Mailbox to earn Royalty Payments.
Sims in the Inspired emotion will generally be better Violinists.
Sims with a higher level Violin skill will learn new, more challenging Songs, unlock new musical interactions, and will be able to Write Songs.
Sims in the Inspired emotion will generally be better Writers.
Sims who are dedicated enough writers can write as their career.
Writing is an art that takes time. As Sims develop their Writing skill, they'll be able to write more interesting Books which will earn more Simoleons in Royalties.
Personality Traits give Sims unique interactions, behaviors, and preferences throughout their life.
Sims gain new Personality Traits when they age up, up to 3 total when they become young adults.
Sims gain Reward Traits by completing Aspirations or can purchase new Traits with Satisfaction at the Rewards Store.

Sims need to use Upgrade Parts to upgrade items. These can be found in piles of junk next to broken objects or even in garbage cans!\n\nYou can also purchase upgrade parts from the Order menu, if you have enough Handiness skill.
Sims in the Focused Emotion will generally be better at upgrading household items.
As your Handiness Skill improves, you'll be able to find rare Upgrade Parts and unlock more powerful upgrades.
Some Upgrade benefits will make objects perform better, not break, or provide emotional benefits to Sims.
Sims can visit the local bar or lounge for a refreshing drink, or perhaps the park for a little outdoor excitement with friends.
You can also create your own Venues by clicking the Build button in a lot’s option tray.\n\nChange the Venue type within the Lot Info Panel.

To visit a venue, click on your Sim's phone and select Travel, then select the destination!\n\nYou can also hit the [m] key to view the Map, and travel from there. Venues will have a bubble over them to indicate their venue type.
Sims can also use the phone to invite friends over to visit by using the Plan a Social Event.\n\nOr, open up your Relationship Panel [r], click on a Sims portrait and choose Invite To...
Your Sims' neighbors will stop by from time to time for a visit. You can also visit neighbors your Sims already know via the Travel interaction on the phone.

Hover over a Whim to find out more detail about what your Sim wants to do.\n\nThe description will tell you what and how you can accomplish each Whim, as well as the Satisfaction reward, which you can use in the Rewards Store.
Whims are quick to short term goals that your Sims have for themselves. Whims will appear as thought balloons around your Sim's thumbnail in the lower left.
The left-most Whim is the Emotional Whim. The Emotional Whim is always either something about helping your Sim stay in or transition out of their current Emotion.

You can ignore a Whim, it will not have a negative impact on your Sim.\n\nYou can also dismiss current Whims by clicking on the X next to the Whim thought balloon. This will remove that Whim from your Sim, and eventually refresh with a new Whim after a short period of time.
Get directly to the Map of your active world by clicking the Map button in the upper-right hud in Live mode or use the F5 hotkey.

In Manage Worlds mode on the Map, you'll find a number of different options that pop up in the lower right corner when you click on any lot. Depending on whether it's residential or a venue, occupied or unoccupied, you'll get options appropriate for that lot. You'll always have the option to either visit or build on any lot. Find additional actions under the more button.
If you choose to visit a lot, the Household Picker will appear to help you choose households or Sims from either your played or unplayed households to bring with.

If a selected residential lot is occupied, you can learn a little bit about who lives there by clicking on the household info buttons or the individual Sim buttons in the lower left corner of the screen.

The individual Sim Info Panel not only has information about the Sim's personality, but it's also a fast and easy way for you to track them down if they're away from home, even between different worlds. Click the direct play button within the Sim Info Panel to quickly dive in game and play as that Sim. It's so convenient!

Toddlers can use their diaper to fulfill their Bladder need, but maybe you don’t want a little stinker running around. Get a Potty, and Potty Train your Toddler!\n\nClick on the Potty and choose Potty Train. As your Toddler gets better at using the Potty, they will be able to go on their own with confidence!

Toddlers have a special relationship with some Sims; their Parents and Caregivers. Sims that fall into one of those two groups will concern themselves with and care for the Needs of the toddler.\n\nYou can also choose to become (or remove) yourself as a Caregiver by selecting the Adopt as Care Dependent interaction in the Toddler Care menu.

Time for bed… or maybe it’s just time for the adults to relax. You can let your little ones sleep on the floor, couch, or a chair, but your Toddler will rest better if you click on the Toddler or a Toddler Bed and choose Put to Sleep, or Read to Sleep.

For optimal toddler happiness, you should head into Build Mode and browse the Toddler sort. Toddler Beds, High Chairs, Pottys, Tablets… everything a growing toddler needs!\n\nAll of these can be found by clicking on Objects by Room / Kids’ Room sort, and then clicking on the stack of blocks to open up the Toddlers sort.

Toddlers need others to provide for their Needs. A Toddler Bed, High Chair, and Potty will also greatly help to ensure your Toddler is getting the best care. Make sure to pay attention to your Toddlers’ Needs or you might find the Social Worker will whisk away your little tyke.

Toddlers begin by stumbling about, but with time they learn to climb stairs, and eventually run. Toddlers can gain Movement Skill by going places, bobbing or dancing to music or even Stacking with Nesting Blocks.\n\nUpon age up into Child, Movement Skill will boost the Toddlers’ Motor Skill.

Toddlers can build upon 5 levels of Communication Skill by doing things like Talk or Babble with other Sims or Learn with Flash Cards. As the Toddler advances their Communication Skill, new interactions will become available for the Toddler.\n\nUpon age up, a high Communication Skill will allow the Toddler to get a boost in their Social Skill.

Thinking Skill gauges a Toddler's mental progression. Toddlers can build Thinking Skill by doing things like the Show Flash Cards or Ask Why interactions, or by choosing the Study interactions on Nesting Blocks.\n\nWhen a Toddler ages into a Child, Thinking Skill will boost the Toddlers Mental Skill.

There are three levels of Potty Skill for the Toddler to advance through. Building Potty Skill can occur by using the Potty, or Asking for Potty Help from a Caregiver.\n\nAs the Toddler becomes more proficient with their Potty use, they may find they have less accidents, and adults will have less difficulty changing their diaper.

Toddlers have 5 skills of their very own. Each skill can be built upon by interacting with other Sims or objects. Advancing in each of the Toddler Skills (except for Potty) provides a boost to future Child skills.\n\nAs your Toddler increases their skills, you might find it becomes less time consuming as you care for their Needs.

Imagination Skill is meant to measure a Toddler’s creativity. Being in the Playful emotion will help to boost Imagination Skill gains, along with things like Playing with Toys or the Dollhouse, or Reading.\n\nUpon age up into a Child, Imagination Skill will result in a boost to the Creativity skill.

Press the camera button (or press C) to take a screenshot of the game. Press the video button (or press V) to start/stop video capture. Click the picture button to view all the screenshots and memories that have been captured.
Taking Screenshots and Video in the Sims 4 has never been easier. Simply click the shutter button found next to the time controls.

The default camera style does not have the option to Pitch (or Tilt) the camera. As you zoom the camera in and out, it moves along a path that allows for an easier experience for viewing your Sims.\n\nYou can modify this setting in the Game Options / Controls & Camera tab.

Sims 4 has two camera styles. The default style allows you to click on open terrain and drag to move the camera.

Both camera styles behave differently, so experiment with the left, right, and middle mouse buttons to find one that suits your play style.

You can modify the camera style by pressing the Sims 3 / Sims 4 camera buttons at the top right of the screen, press Ctrl+Shift+Tab, or access the Game Camera settings in Game Options.
The options in the Cell Phone menu allow the Sim to do different things like: Invite over a Sim, Travel to a new location, Hire a Service, Pay Bills and even Throw a Party.
The Cell Phone is a very handy device that has a number of important uses. Every Sim automatically has one, which shows up as a button below the Sim’s portrait on the game’s HUD in Live Mode.

Sims can put items back into the world by clicking and holding an item to pick it up.\n\nWhile dragging, valid drop locations will be highlighted yellow (such as a refrigerator, or Sims). In addition to being able to place the object directly onto the ground or valid surfaces.
Sims can interact with items in their personal inventories by opening the inventory (click on the panel in the lower right or use the [i] shortcut key) and clicking the item.
Sims need to spend upgrade parts to upgrade items. Upgrade parts can be found in piles of salvage next to repaired items or can be purchased through the computer.
As Sims improve their Handiness Skill, they'll be able to upgrade their household items. Upgraded items have new benefits. For example, they can be unbreakable!
Sims in the Focused Emotion will generally be better at Handiness interactions.
Broken objects can be repaired with a little time and effort. While repairing, Sims improve their Handiness Skill.
There are some powerful and easy-to-use tools that'll help you quickly build things. Let's examine a few of them now!
Welcome to Create-a-Sim! This is where your story - and characters - begin. Click around and experiment! Click the buttons at the top to give your Sim a name.
Looks are important! Click the Sim to choose their clothing, hair, skin tone, makeup, body shape, and more. Create yourself, someone you know, or even a celebrity.
Who is your Sim? What will they accomplish? First, choose an aspiration, which is a life goal. Click one of the buttons on the left of the screen.
Welcome to The Sims 4! We can't wait to show you all the wild stories you can tell in this game of life.
Sims must Sleep to improve their Energy Need. Click on the bed and tell your Sim to sleep. This way, they'll be fresh and ready for their new job in the morning. Happy Sims make for better employees!
Now is a great time to greet your new housemate, Alex. Click on her to bring up a menu of possible Introductions.
You'll need to know how to control the camera so you can see the things you want to see. Use the buttons and scroll wheel on your Mouse to control the camera. Try it now.

Your Sim should follow Alex inside the house. Right click on Alex's portrait to have the camera follow them. Then, click anywhere on the ground and select "Go Here." If you ever lose track of a Sim, double click their Portrait to find them.
Sims have basic Needs, and right now your Sim is hungry. Don't worry - Alex will prepare a meal for your Sim.

You can always get a preview of your Sim's needs, such as hunger or social, by the color of the diamond indicator above your selected Sim. As it goes from green to red, look to the Needs Panel to see what your Sim needs.
Click on objects to give directions to your Sim. For example, click on the delicious food prepared by Alex and tell your Sim to "Grab a Serving."

Relationships are very important to Sims, both for their stories and their Social Need. Click on Alex and select "Get to Know" to see your Sim start a conversation. Feel free to experiment with friendship or romance to tell the stories that interest you.
Shift your gaze to the top of the screen to see how the conversation is going.

Your job starts tomorrow, if you need to find the time it's right next to the time controls on the bottom center of the screen. Here you can also control the game speed if you need to speed up, slow down, or pause things.

There's many ways to interact with items in your inventory. You can click for options, such as choosing to read the book, or opening the seed packet. You can also click and drag an item to place it in the world, such as placing the seeds to be planted.

Sims need money to pay Bills, buy better household items, and even purchase food. Luckily, we had Alex pull a few strings to get your Sim a sweet job, which starts tomorrow. You can choose a different job later if you don't like this one. You always have choices to make for your Sims.

Actions that you give your Sim will appear in a queue on the left side of the screen. You can mouse over actions in the queue to find out more information, or click to cancel an action you don't want your Sim to take.

Alex has a welcome gift for your Sim. What a great tour guide! You should open your Sim's inventory to see what it is. Think of the Inventory as your Sim's personal pocket, with unlimited space. Hmm, magic pockets.
Your Sim received an assortment of goodies from Alex. The gift included some seeds for a garden, a book, and something to decorate the home. Thanks, Alex!
Play around for a few hours by clicking on household objects, or watch what your Sim chooses to do. Have fun!
Rise and shine! Your Sim should prepare for their first day of work. Click on the shower so your Sim can clean up and fix their Hygiene Need. Co-workers don't like stinky Sims.
Click on the toilet to fix your Sim's Bladder Need. We promise we won't look.
Coffee is delicious and good for an energy boost! Click on the Coffee Maker to brew a cup.
It's time for work! Sims will always go to work on their own, assuming you don't prevent them from doing so.
Click on the Simology Panel to see information about your Sim. This is where you can view traits, age, genealogy, and other fun stats about your Sim.
Your Sim is at work, but you can take control of Alex by clicking on their Portrait. Have fun, you can't really do anything wrong.

We'll leave you alone for a while to let you play. Tell Alex to read, clean up, or just relax. Or, watch what Alex chooses to do. Sims think for themselves and pursue their own agenda if you let them.

You have some free time after work to take care of your Sim. Pay attention to their needs, and if you lose track of your progress, make sure to refer back to your Sim's Aspiration panel on the bottom right to review their goals.
Your Sim is home from work, a little tired, but with more money in their pocket. Now is a good time to prepare dinner by clicking on the fridge, have a conversation, or relax with a little TV.

Alex has the house to herself while your Sim is off at work. Remember you can take control of Alex by clicking on her portrait, so spend the day giving her things to do, or watch what she does on her own.

Welcome home! Your Sim is working steadily towards a promotion. Completing the Daily Tasks and Promotion Tasks are critical for career success! Click the briefcase button near the bottom of the screen to learn more about your career.
Sims have an Aspiration, which is their life goal. Click on the Aspiration button on the bottom of the screen to learn more about aspirations.
Every Aspiration has multiple levels called milestones. To progress to the next level, complete the goals. Your Sim is on the right track.

Your Sim needs to work on their Daily Task to earn a promotion. Some of these Daily Tasks require your Sim to improve a skill or complete tasks for work. Being on track with work tasks will put your Sim on a successful career path. Look at your Sim's Career Panel to learn what their Daily Tasks are.

You now have Free Play time until you complete all of your Sim’s Aspiration goals. Check your progress in the Aspirations panel. And remember to take care of their needs, but most importantly... have fun!
Your Sim improved their Skill! Click on the lightbulb button to see your Sim's progress with their Skills.
Your Sim deserves time off from work. They can use their phone to spend Vacation days whenever they wish.
Your Sim can travel around the neighborhood to leave the house and get some fresh air. You can Travel by using the Phone.
Your Sim can bring Alex along for the ride, at least today. In the future, as your Sim makes friends and romantic partners, they can invite these Sims to meet out on the town.
The park is full of friendly folks. Your Sim should talk to some of them!

Your Sims might build several relationships over time. Keep tabs on their social life by clicking on the Relationship icon down at the bottom. Generally, if you need to learn something about your Sim, click a button down here.
It's time to head back home. Your Sims can always return home no matter where they are by selecting the Go Home button on their portrait. It's the teeny tiny little house.
Your Sim was promoted! This means a new title, more money, rewards, but also, more work opportunities!

Your Sim completed their Aspiration. This means they earned Satisfaction points to spend on rewards. Sweet! But, this is just the first step, and there are many more Aspirations from which to choose. Choose a new Aspiration, which will open up new story possibilities for your Sim.
You've learned the basics and are now ready to play on your own. Alex is leaving to help other new players. Bye, Alex!

Your Sim now has the option to Join a new Career that best matches their new Aspiration. Use the Phone or Computer to find a new job. There are many interesting professions to pursue, so don’t be afraid to Quit and try out any until you find one that suits your story.

Now that your Sim has the home to themselves, you can enter Build Mode to redecorate it to your liking. Add rooms, buy new furniture, move things around, and more. Take a look! You can tinker as long as you have money to spend!
If you're in need of inspiration, head to The Gallery. Simmers from around the world upload amazing creations to our safe community of creators. Poke around and download anything you like. It's free!
If you're ever confused or need a refresher, read the Lessons Alex wrote for your Sim in the Options menu.

That's it, we're done. It's up to you now. From here, you can add another Sim to this household, which we recommend, keep playing as you are, or, start a new household entirely. Don't worry, this one will still be available to you.

This residence is listed on the Celebrity Home Tours, granting increased fame gain, restricted access, and awe amongst welcomed visitors. Beware though! Those who live here but aren’t actually very famous will be considered posers!
Increases the chances for pets to have larger pet litters.
Cat owners will visit this lot with their cats.
Stray cats really love this lot. Meow!
Dog owners will visit this lot and bring their dogs.
Stray dogs will hang out at this lot.
Sims gain Pet Training skill faster on this lot.
This lot is near an active volcano! Beware of earthquakes, steam vents, and occasional lava bombs.

A place for the Superstars, the VIPs, those who’ve achieved victory over the commonplace! After all, who else could afford these hyperinflated lot prices? Not you... no. But at least, the Starlight Accolades can only happen on Lounges with this trait.
At least your sims can say they ‘went here before it was cool.’ Also, cheap drinks and eats for the super famous! Even better, Meet a Celebrity events can only happen on Lounges with this trait.
This lot embraces an open, natural lifestyle empowering visitors to shed strict material conventions and prudish societal moors… also their clothes.
It seems that some creepy pests have taken up residence here. Be prepared; when they hit, you'll never see them coming!
Broken things just seem to get mended overnight. It's as if kindly Gnomes watch over the place...
Stuff breaks here a lot. It's like there are tiny goblins who come out at night and smash things...but that's ridiculous, right?
Ancient Island spirits inhabit this lot, visiting frequently. How will Sims choose to interact with them?
This lot has an abundance of ocean life. Swimming in the ocean is an inspiring endeavor and dolphins and rare fish are easily found here.
This lot isn't connected to electricity or plumbing (meaning no utility bills either). Talk about natural living!
The dark energy here has a impact on all nocturnal activities. You can expect babies conceived here to require extra care while teething.
Something about this lot makes it great for reading. Sims understand more, so they gain skill faster from reading, and Tense moods go away faster.

More teens will hang out in the neighborhood that surrounds this lot. You'll spot them roaming around and loitering in the streets, as teens are known to do. It's a good opportunity for teens in your household to meet new friends their own age!
A dark void envelopes this lot in the upside down. Vampires are more likely to visit the area.

The lot registers as a vampire lair. The League will send various gifts from time to time. Through the mail, no less. Even the immortals use the public mail service. Only available on home residences.
You should meet us at the bar, we want to go out tonight.
The bar is a perfect place for a get together.
A good night is on the horizon! Join us at the bar.
The Bar is a great place to wind down at the end of the day and meet a few friends (or make new ones).
The Beach is a great place to relax by the water. Whether you like to tan in the sun, build sand sculptures, or enjoy the warm waters, there is something here for almost anyone.
You should come out tonight! We will be the life of the party at the club.
We are going to get the party started!
It's time for us to take over the club.
The Nightclub is an excellent place to dance, enjoy the music, and have a delightful concoction.
Grill some hot dogs and enjoy a family picnic in a serene forest.
This venue does not qualify as any type and therefore cannot trigger Social Events.
We want to work out together.
Time to get pumped with us.
Come join us for a little exercise.
The local Gym is where you come to get fit, get mean, and get more attractive.
We want to see you at the library. Be there and be square.
Shhh! Come to the library where we will be meeting.
Looking for a little quite time? Join us at the library.
The Library is a great public resource. It's where one comes to enjoy some peace and quiet, and even read a few books!
Come to the lounge, we want to sing the night away!
Bring your dancing shoes, we will be meeting up at the lounge.
Come out tonight with us. We'll be relaxing at the lounge.
When you don't want to sit at the bar and don't want a wild night at the Club, come to the Lounge for good conversation and tasty beverages.
Catch up on your history at the museum with us.
The museum is a great place to learn. We will be meeting up there soon.
Art won't view itself. You should join us for a meeting at the museum.
The Museum is a collection of community and worldwide art, showcasing that taste sometimes, but not always, has a place on your wall.
We will be heading to the park. You should meet us there!
How about a nice walk with us at the park.
It's a great day to spend time outside. Join us at the park.
Take a stroll around this beautiful outdoor space. Watch the kids scream with delight around the playground.
Grab your swimsuit and join us at the pool.
The pool is the best way to spend a hot summer day. Meet us there!
We want to enjoy the water at the pool. You should meet us there.
The pool is a great place to take a dip and catch some rays.
The Pool is great place to socialize or to have a private moment. Go for a swim, show off your jumping skills or sit back and relax poolside and enjoy.
You’re invited for a night in with us.
This is a place for Households to call Home.
There are no special requirements for this type of venue.
The Brickery with Stone Corner Accent
Applause Clapboard with Charcoal Brick and Wood Trim
The Brickery Elite with Corner Accent
The Brickery Elite with Wood Trim
Better Days Brick Facade with Corner Accent
Better Days Brick Facade with Wood Trim
IndustryMatters Brick Facade with Corner Accent
IndustryMatters Brick Facade with Wood Trim

The Notification Wall displays a maximum of 200 notifications. 
 
 If you do nothing, the oldest notifications will automatically be deleted as new notifications appear. 
 
 You can make room by deleting individual notifications from the wall at any time, or by clicking on the trash can on the wall to delete all currently stored notifications.
Work Out on a Workout Machine
A Yoga class is beginning in 30 minutes. Please notify the Yoga instructor if you wish to participate.
Lots of things seem to go wrong here.
Locals say this place is haunted. Pah! What do they know?
The neighbors live life to the max. There's often a party going on.
A great place to practice your Handiness skills!
Rent is higher than average for this Apartment.
Kids just seem to learn faster here.
This situation is unavailable at this location due to the Clothing Optional lot trait.
The spacious but intimate feel makes it easier to practice Charisma, Comedy and Mischief to your heart's content.
From clogged sewers to grimy counters, this place seems to get dirty really quickly.
Oodles of fresh air make for a bracing environment to exercise.
The acoustics are perfect here! A great place for any musician to hone their skills.
Gardening just seems to go really well here.
Sims have a chance to get nauseous when eating, drinking or using the bathroom.
A great online connection helps out those looking to improve their Programming, Video Gaming or Writing skills.
The homey vibe helps Sims quickly master the domestic arts of Cooking, Mixology, Handiness and Gardening.
The Mean Vibe makes it easier to get other Sims angry with Mean or Mischief interactions.
The quality of light here makes Painting and Photography much easier to master.
A home lot with this trait deters all but the most determined visitors (It has little effect on commercial venues).
Sims often find loose change around the place. It's like there's a secret money fairy or something.
Occasionally there’s a minor tremor here. Probably nothing to worry about…
Romantic Aura makes it easier to get other people in the mood for LURVE!
The secluded vibe means there's little to distract great minds from the study of Logic or Rocket Science.
The beautiful scenery really make this place uplifting. When the sun goes down, Sims may get Energized, Happy, or Inspired.
The local school is great! Kids seem to get high grades and usually do better at homework.
Rent is cheaper than average for this Apartment.
Food prepared in this kitchen will enhance your Sims' culinary skills. Look out famous Chefs!
Parties just seem to go well at this place! Meeting Social Event goals becomes much easier.
The beautiful views are sure to lift anyone's spirits.
The Landlord has one rule - the Inspirational plaque dedicated to a famous historical resident can never be removed or sold.
The artsy vibe makes this a great place to be creative. Painting, Writing, and Woodworking usually comes out better quality.
The deposit for this apartment is suspiciously low...
Full of funky fertile earth energy, twins are born here more often than not.
Maybe it's the insulation or maybe the neighbors are very polite. Either way, it's never noisy here.
A flirty vibe radiates from the beautiful fireplace in this apartment. The Landlord won't allow this fireplace to be removed or sold.
The rent for this apartment includes maid service.
Legend tells of an ancient island counter from the jungle, but no one believed it until now! Recently discovered deep in the Omiscan ruins of Selvadorada this island is no longer a myth.
This cute little plant likes to be placed near other potted plants and trees, but it's time for them to grow up and be independent. Spread your wings and fly, little bro!
For those that want just want to bring a little jungle into their life. This lovely plant pairs well with other assorted flora and fauna, but is robust enough to stand on its own.

This poor tree used to be constantly surrounded by friends. But not anymore! It has been ripped from it's comfort zone and added to the Sims' supply for their placement pleasure! Enjoy and happy decorating.
When from the wind chime, there arose such a clatter... {0.SimFirstName} sprang from the bed to see what was the matter!

Logging into The Sims 4 Gallery allows you to view creations made by other players, post comments, get updates from creators you are following, and select items from the Gallery to later download into your The Sims 4 game. Other players, including your Origin friends, can follow you in the Gallery and view your Gallery profile. You can also see who is following you. If you do not want anyone to follow you or view your Gallery profile, simply change your Origin privacy settings so that “No One” can see your profile. With this setting, other players will still be able to view and comment on content you have uploaded to the Gallery. By using, you certify compliance with EA's User Agreement.

Gather your garden produce to make a Harvestfest feast to celebrate with friends and family. Enjoy the changing leaves (and leaf piles) before things get chilly.
Spring is a great time to plant your garden to take advantage of spring showers, but watch out for those mud puddles!
Temperatures are climbing, so beat the heat with water balloons and sprinklers. Watch out for the thunderstorms, they can be electrifying!
When you’re not bundled up indoors, have some fun in the snow or on the ice. Don’t forget to decorate for Winterfest and plan your New Year’s resolutions!

Do you want this Sim to be able to become a celebrity? They'll have to start from the bottom and build their way to stardom.
This Sim will be able to gain fame and become a celebrity. Default fame settings for all Sims can be set in the Game Options.

WARNING: This action will reset any fame gained by this Sim to zero. If the Sim steps back into the spotlight later, they will restart from there.\n\nOnce out of the spotlight, the Sim will not gain any fame or become a celebrity. This button will then allow them to reverse this decision at any time.
Sims with Fame Perks can't quit the spotlight. To remove Fame Perks from a Sim, use the phone or computer to Book a Celebrity Cleanse.
This Sim's fame will be reset and they will no longer gain fame. Default fame settings for all Sims can be set in the Game Options.

As a Sim increases their Celebrity Level, they drift further from normal life. At certain levels, Sims will gain new Quirk Slots, which can be filled with Quirks based on the behavior they engage in.

Once acquired, Quirks may be removed by using the Celestial Crystal Crown or drinking the Quirk-B-Gone reward potion. Removing a quirk will open up the slot, which may then get filled by a new quirk!

The Sim's current quirks may be seen under Earned Quirks, while all possible quirks can be seen under All Quirks.
\nA celebrity's behavior determines what quirks they develop.
\nThis quirk slot is locked until you've reached a higher Celebrity Level.

{0.SimName} has lost fame and is now a {1.String}.

A Sim's Public Image is comprised of Reputation and Celebrity Level. Reputation is what others think of them, and can be changed by doing certain behaviors while being observed by others. Celebrity Level measures how famous they are, and can be increased by performing actions that gain fame. Attaining levels gain Fame Points, which can be spent in the Fame Info Panel to unlock new Fame Perks. The panel may also be used to opt a Sim out of fame gain entirely.

Character Values determine a Sim's ability to adapt and behave effectively in everyday life. Each value can be positive or negative.\n\nHover over each of the Values below to view interactions that the child can do to influence Character Values. Parents can also influence these values by using Parenting Interactions.

Sims Begin Opted Out of Fame
Toggling this option will adjust if Sims have the ability to gain fame by default or not.

Adjusts if Sims gain fame by default. If checked, Sims will no longer gain fame.

The following Sims will be affected:
• Sims who have not yet gained any fame.
• All newly created Sims.

The following Sims will not be affected:
• Sims that have already gained any fame.
• Sims who have had their fame settings individually adjusted in Live Mode.

This setting can be overridden, and the fame status of individual Sims can be changed at any time by selecting "Step Into the Spotlight" within the Fame Info window.
Enables unplayed Sims to age over time. If disabled, your Sims will not age up.
Adjusts the level of free will that Sims demonstrate. When Off, Sims will only react to events in order to preserve their own lives
Disables Autonomy for the selected household member while other Sims roam free with Autonomy On.
Enables Sims to age over time. If disabled, your Sims will not age up.
Adjusts the lifespan of your Sims. The higher this setting, the longer your Sims live.
Toggle the automatic NPC population of Empty Homes in the Neighborhood.
Enabling this shows whims over the Sim's head in the bottom left corner of the screen.
Hides the challenge UI for the currently active challenge only. May only be changed while a challenge is active.\n\nYou may continue to participate in a challenge even with the UI hidden.
Enables the legacy style pie menu, grouping actions by type rather than by contextual relevance.
Autonomy settings are disabled while the tutorial is active.

A higher limit on Sims could lead to an increase of load times, especially on slower machines.
Adjusts the 3D object resolution (without reducing UI resolution). Lower settings improve framerate.
Adjusts the primary display mode of the game to Fullscreen, Windowed, or Windowed Fullscreen.
Adjusts the anti-aliasing. Higher settings make edges appear softer, but also may reduce rendering performance.
Enables faster rendering and reduces visual quality.
Adjusts the quality of lighting and shadows. Higher settings may impact rendering performance.
Adjusts the level of detail on objects. Higher settings may impact rendering performance.
Enables global focus, lighting, and shadowing effects.
Adjusts the quality of reflections on water and mirrors. Higher settings may impact game performance.
Adjusts the number of times the image is drawn to the screen. If the refresh rate is too low, you may see a flicker.
Adjusts the window size and graphical resolution. Choose a resolution that matches the aspect ratio of your monitor.
Adjusts the level of detail on Sims. Higher settings may impact game performance.
